items.title: Reix 2021 Resolute Enduro Indoor Extreme
items.creator: Resolute Kraken
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Welcome to
Resolute Enduro Indoor eXtreme
(REIX).  This track is a replica of the SEIX (Super Enduro Indoor eXtreme –
https://superenduroseix.com
) facility in Ocaña, Spain.  The SEIX track was designed by team Sherco rider Mario Roman.  This track was created as a beginner level Endurocross/SuperEnduro course in preparation for more advanced tracks to be released as part of a future EX series in 2022.
Just like anything, it takes some practice to do endurocross in MXB so if you don’t have the patience to learn then you probably want to keep moving past this post.  If you are having problems with slow physics – just go faster.
My tracks are mainly made for my own riding enjoyment while learning new tools and methods in Blender. This track took roughly 3 months and 300+ hours to create. Most of the time was spent on the environment models, baking shadow maps for all those objects, and the terrain masks using those shadow maps.  The heightmaps were created entirely in Blender. I’ve tried to make it as close to 1:1 scale as possible while still being rideable and fun in MXB.  A lot of experimentation and testing was done to work around the MXB physics for the EX obstacles. This was mainly done with the use of two heightmaps.
Special Thanks:
– GreenLenux for custom wall art, logos, and bike model
– iNsane for bike model and EDF conversion + information on FRM file format
– Osmeralda for log base model
– JV for water tank model
– GioPanda for base fence model and trailer tires

items.title: 2025 Racecraft Sx Preseason Test Track
items.creator: 3F Dirt Works
items.description:
Description
Downloads
2025 Racecraft SX Series Powered by Next Level Racing – Round #0: Preseason Test Track
Welcome to the kickoff of the 2025 Racecraft SX Series with our
Preseason Test Track
, inspired by the legendary 2009 St. Louis Supercross. This track holds a special place in motocross history as it was
Travis Pastrana’s last SX race
, and fittingly, it was designed by the man himself.
True to the spirit of that unforgettable night, this track brings intense
bar-to-bar action and technical challenges
that demand focus and precision. This circuit emphasizes smooth riding and strategic throttle control over simply holding down the right trigger. It’s a test of consistency and skill, with no pre-made ruts to guide you—requiring riders to find their own rhythm through every corner and obstacle.
Get ready for a track that pushes the boundaries of Racecraft. Can you handle the challenge?
Download now and prove your skills in the preseason!
Special Thanks
A huge shoutout to
RedRider
for providing all the incredible asset models that bring this track to life. Your hard work and attention to detail elevate the experience and make this project possible. Thank you for your contribution to the MX Bikes community!
We’d also like to extend our gratitude to our amazing sponsors:
Next Level Racing
Viral Goggles
Fusion Graphics
Thank you for supporting the series and providing such awesome prizes for the riders. Your contributions help make the 2025 Racecraft SX Series unforgettable!

items.title: Procworks Snocross Rd 6
items.creator: DevoPROCworks
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Welcome to Round 6 of the “PROCworks Snocross Championship”
Featuring a Daytime Track for Motos under the sun, and Night version for those end of the day finals.
A fun long Motocross style track built into the local Ski Hills. The owners let us pull out the Snowcats to build something fun for the community! Featuring many fun sections for very fast flowing racing, But once it gets rough it may get the best of you. With a couple pretty big doubles you may want to bump up or down a tooth in your gearing for the top end. Theres a handful of freeride hits leftover from the snowboard park on Hill 1. A small freestyle jump show course. And a bit of a historic freeride jump over a ski chair lift up top, so you can go for it like Jay Quinlan back in the day!
This track is my best yet, I spent a lot of time working on custom assets and perfecting my masking abilities. I really tried to really bring the track to life. Very proud of this project and what i have learning building it.
Thank You to my Supporters and the Earthwurx Crew for always holding it down when im asking any questions!
Features 2 Tracks in the download for “Daytime” and “Night”.
Also included is the Server Versions.
***Big Credits to these Asset Creators***
Kogan – Earthwurx Inflatable
RedRider197 – Semi pack, SX Bales, Earthwurx Machines, Pit Swag

Hey Guys Fischi here,
I would like to introduce you to
Beaston.
This
is my second track that I made.
I put a lot of sweat and tears into the track and hope you like it as much as I do.
I have less knowledge of the program on the PC and therefore have to start completely from scratch to teach myself everything. That is why I am even happier to say that this is the result. Of course, things are always getting better and I will try to constantly improve myself. I hope that some people will like the track and of course people will recognize the potential of my tracks.
I think the result is very good considering it is my second track. Of course, none of this would have been possible without tips and tricks from experienced track builders.

items.title: The Aspect Proving Grounds Beta
items.creator: NealWheels
items.description:
Description
Downloads
It’s time to get this off my drive.  I originally started making this for MX Bikes a few years back, then ended up converting it to MXS.  I wish I had the will to finish it for Mx Bikes, as it absolutely had more visual potential to work with this game.  Unfortunately, after putting all that time into the MXS version, doing it all over again has seemed to be an impossible task.
Today I am releasing my most recent (and final) version of The Aspect Proving Grounds.  As of now, I don’t plan on finishing it.  I plan on moving on to a smaller, more manageable project.  I think the compound is relatively fun to cruise around on, which is why I won’t let it just rot on my hard drive.
Here are some images of what it looks like in MXS:
Thanks to the EarthWurx crew for helping me along the way, sorry that I couldn’t finish this.
Enjoy!

items.title: Las Vegas Smx One One Smx Finale
items.creator: RedRum Track Crew
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Welcome to the 2024 SMX season finale, brought to you by the RedRum Track Crew. This is the last of the three rounds to end the 2024 championship. For those who have not participated in the SX or MX series, you can still race the finale on Dec 9 by joining the One-One SMX Discord and qualifying in through the LCQ. All levels of riders are welcome!
This last round is a fictional track based in Las Vegas. The track goes through the stadium and exits into the a Nevada desert environment  with a large mix of SX and MX areas throughout the track, including a split section for riders to decide between an MX or SX lane. The start is also split and extremely tight, so gate pick will be crucial.  It’s both technical and high speed, with multiple line choices in the the corners and rhythm lanes. The track is built for 250s, but flows great on 450s as well.
Since this is the final round of 2024, we also added a straight rhythm in the parking lot.
Special thanks:
RedRider, Resolute Kraken, AGMX, Giopanda, Mouk Lab, Kellz, Cody James, PHANTOMZ, TFC, Navo, NKSTUF, JV, L0wpoly, VT Studios and anyone else I forgot for their awesome tutorials, assets, and whatever else got us to this point.

items.title: Outpost
items.creator: punkerjeffy
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Outpost is a sand track inspired by the layout of the Wildwood Beach Race in New Jersey, originally designed by
MX Track Builders
. While I’ve kept the general layout, I’ve tweaked the jump scaling and added a few new elements to make it ride better. The primary version of the track is unprepped and rough, built to reflect how the track would naturally form up over a long race day. You’ll need to get creative with your lines to put in a fast lap. For a different experience, I’ve also included a fully prepped version with a morning atmosphere, giving you the feeling of being the first rider on the track.
Thanks to:
Resolute Kraken for his tools
Giopanda for the acerbis stakes
There’s quite a few links below, so make sure you download the right one.

items.title: Temecula Creek
items.creator: punkerjeffy
items.description:
Description
Downloads
I grew up in Temecula, and almost every weekend my dad and brother and I would ride from our house out through this canyon to Vail Lake dam. Most of the time it was a dried-out creek bed, which is how I recreated it here, but sometimes it turned into a rushing river with crazy water crossings. The canyon was filled with all kinds of stuff: rusty shot-up cars, figure-eight tracks, hill climbs, freeride jumps, and tons of fun trails.
This place holds a lot of great memories, so I thought it would be cool to make a track here. While it’s scaled down, the terrain itself stays true to the real location which is based off satellite data. I adjusted where the dam is slightly and scaled it up to make it more visible from the track. The creek bed has a sandy look and feel while the hills are made to look hard pack, but the track only uses soft soil for consistency. I added a sky for every weather condition, with the cloudy option being an orange sunrise. My apologies for the file size but I did my best to optimize it. A lot of the size comes from the amount of off-track objects to make the scenery look as realistic as possible.
A huge thanks to Totes McGoats for testing and feedback. My current lap times are around 2:25, but there’s definitely room for improvement.

items.title: Virollet 1986
items.creator: Rody Van Halen
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Hi everyone! This is my very first mod.
It’s a replica of a track that unfortunately no longer exists today, the Virollet track in France, in its 1986 version.
A little backstory: my dad competed in his first championships on this track in 1985 and 1986. It was a different time, as my dad didn’t have much in terms of gear—his setup was just a helmet, gloves, a t-shirt, and jeans. The 1986 season on the Virollet track was particularly memorable for him. Both my dad and his brother had serious crashes during that race. But that didn’t stop them ! In fact, that same year, at Saint Jean d’Angély (a track many will know), my dad finished 2nd.
I wanted to recreate this track, which has since been replaced by a landfill in 2006, to give my dad the chance to relive the track he loved during his youth.
This track isn’t perfect. There are no archives except for some old photos I found in my parents’ attic, and my dad’s own memories to help me piece it together.
This is the first version, and I would love to get your feedback and advice on what can be improved.
The track is best suited for 125cc and 250cc, but on a 450cc, it starts getting tricky. Good luck—it’s a fairly technical track, and the last section of the course is quite challenging.
Thanks a lot to everyone who downloads it and provides constructive feedback.
Enjoy !
12-08-24 Update : Reupload of the image that had disappeared from the post.

items.title: Texas Motorplex Smx One One Smx R2
items.creator: RedRum Track Crew
items.description:
Description
Downloads
A collaborative effort between Newskool and Dr.PhDeez, the RedRum Track Crew brings you round 2 of the One-One 2024 SMX championship. This is the second of three rounds to end the 2024 championship. For those who have not participated in the SX or MX series, you can still race the SMX series on Dec 9 by joining the One-One SMX Discord and qualifying in through the LCQ. All levels of riders are welcome!
This second round is a fictional track based on the Texas Motorplex dragstrip in Ennis, Texas. The track is broken into four sections, MX-SX-MX,-SX.  It’s both technical and high speed, with multiple line choices in the the corners and rhythm lanes. The whoops are a little rough this round so you’ll wanna practice your entry. The track is built for 250s, but flows great on 450s as well.
Special thanks:

items.title: The Worm Hole
items.creator: J-PRING
items.description:
Description
Downloads
WELCOME TO
THE WORM HOLE!
by J-PRING
Get ready to rumble riding on a track straight out of a science fiction horror story! This destruction derby figure-8-inspired track attempts to bring a Wreckfest-style, chaos-injected experience to
MX Bikes
. It’s not just about speed; it’s about surviving the insanity as riders throw down over a massive, gaping pit that is the mouth of a giant sandworm. Rows of razor-sharp teeth and flailing tentacles, ready to devour any unlucky rider who falls into its maw.
Crossing jumps mean mid-air collisions are fair game. It’s every rider for themselves, with no guarantee of making it out alive.
Author Notes:
Thanks for checking out my Track!!!! Since releasing ‘The Moon Hole’ I have started work on a fairly large project. While working on it, I had an idea for another track that I figured I could produce relatively easily and quickly. It would also allow me to learn and implement some new things that I would need for the big project. This is my 2nd track and it took me just over 2 weeks to produce. Just a short, simple track with some cool features. Also threw in a few easter eggs!
(4 content creator easter eggs,
1 “Big Project” easter egg)
Help me keep my tracks free for everyone with a donation 🙂

items.title: 2025 Tampa Supercross And Skatepark
items.creator: EvergreenMotoTrax
items.description:
Description
Downloads
UPDATE: There was a hurricane, really bad one. Flying debris took out all the signs and most of the picnic tables. The green/wood skatepark and the tough blocks were lifted up by a tornado and scattered across the Bay. Thankfully, the dirt movers and the concrete skatepark survived and the whole process reduced the file size by close to half, the file size for the model is less than half of what it was. The signs were a large part of the file size I was trying to reduce and I couldn’t find a way to make them optimized, there were 44 of them and they were all 4k textures for readability so the tornado got them.
Also there’s a little flooding surrounding the track but it looks nice
This is based on the proposed track map for the real life 2025 Tampa Supercross.
I tried to make it feel like a local park in the Tampa Bay area made a replica for the locals to practice on and give them a home field advantage.
Testing was done on all bikes, so the new OEMs make all the jumps even on a 250
Surrounding the track is a paved trail with freeride pavilions and 2 skateparks – one of those prebuilt wood parks you will find in any small town across America in various layouts, and a custom concrete bowl.
For the paved trail I suggest the A kit bikes because they have supermoto levels of grip on the asphalt surface.
Cloudy weather has a night skybox with a lot of stars to pretend like you’re sneaking in to get more laps in after the track is closed for the night. Enable “Flashlight” in Reshade to turn on the headlight.
There are corkboards with all of your favorite MXBikes video content creators along the paved trail. Contact me here if you would like to be included in this way on my next track, I tried to include as many video creators as possible but I know there are more than I was able to have the mental memory to include.
The track includes 2 different versions, a smooth version and a rough version.
Thank you to Resolute Kraken for the Track Builder program
Thank you Red Rider for the asset packs and texture brush pack
Thank you Cody and Kellz for the trees
Thank you Callum22 for the jump template
Thank you Panic Rev for the reshade tip for night-mode
Thank you King MX and everyone at Erect Erections for the support
Thank you Scrallex for fixing the norms on the Skidsteer

items.title: Frozen Creek Mx One One Mx R10
items.creator: Dr.PhDeez
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Bring your jackets! We’re racing the final round of the One-One MX series in Anchorage, Alaska. If you want to race this track on Monday, Nov. 11, 2024, find the One-One server or myself on Discord and we’ll help get you signed up. We accept any level of rider, from beginner to pro, so don’t be shy.
This track is entirely conceptual, built to look like a race-ready track after a bit of snowfall. The majority of the terrain is dirt with some mud and snow in some areas around the track, along with some areas that are completely snow or starting to melt. I spent countless hours on getting the textures to look realistic and change as they’re ridden on. The snow will look like its compacting down from the weight of the bike riding over it, while the dirt will start to look a little slick and muddy from the snow mixing with the dirt. Throw on some erode and it looks wonderful.
This track isn’t too difficult, but features ruts and bumps, a few big sends, along with some technical areas and multiple line choices in the corners. It’s also been adapted and tested extensively to ride well with the new OEMS. Lastly, the snow has sand physics so it will pull the bike in and slow it down just as you’d expect.
There’s been some recent reports from locals spotting Bigfoot and the Abominable Snowman in the area, so keep an eye out.
Special thanks –
One-One SMX Series
NewSkool for doing the race data/camera/marshals and helping me ideate and build some of the track
Lynds, RedRider, Resolute Kraken, AGMX, Giopanda, Mouk Lab, Kellz, Cody James, PHANTOMZ, TFC, Navo, L0wpoly and anyone else I forgot for their awesome tutorials, assets, and whatever else got me this point. Couldn’t have made this without you all!

items.title: The Field
items.creator: billyBoB444
items.description:
Description
Downloads
this is my 4th track release, i put a lot of effort into building this track. i think it will be enjoyed by the average skill level player. the track features a large variety of obstacles including but not limited to corners with multiple ruts, flat corners, off cambered corners, scrub jumps, whip jumps, full send jumps, sand sections, and mild roughness.  line selection along with throttle control will be important. the track is quite difficult on 450s and requires lots of patience but is still very fun. i also recommend playing the track with erode on.
i would like to thank everyone that has helped me complete this track!
lynds- tutorial videos
tfc- tutorial videos
red rider- assets and brushes
kellz/ cody- assets
agitatos – assets
gio panda – asstets
ryan – garages
all i ask from the people that download and try this track, is that you leave good and constructive criticism in the comments. “this track sucks” does me no good in learning how to build better ones.

items.description:
Description
Downloads
The Official Round 1 of the AKSMX series, starting this Friday, 10-17
A-Kit discord
I wanted to create something that played similar to how the real life tracks did. This same principle is reflected in the next two rounds as well.
Check out the
A-Kit discord
for updates on the series. Finalizing details, expect to see race information and a sign up form on mymxb later today. The 250 class will be an open class (OEM/AK) and will allow for qualifying entry without sign up – first come first serve so I would advise you still sign up when you see the post.
There is a Jackpot version of this track that is going to be reserved for the paid entry class, do not expect a public release of that track. That version will come password locked with the password handed out just before the Jackpot main event.
There will be a different format for this event. Be sure to follow along on the

items.title: Savannah Supercross 2
items.creator: tunasty
items.description:
Description
Downloads
This is my first track ever made! I wanted to start simple and wasn’t originally going to upload this but I figured I would after all just to see my progress in track making. This track is by any means NOT perfect aesthetically but I did what I could haha. I remade ‘Savannah Supercross” from MX Vs. ATV Unleashed to the best of my current ability. I used to play that track all the time as a kid so for me it brings some nostalgia. I decided to go with this track solely because of the simplicity in design but I do hope you guys enjoy it! Any feedback would be awesome and I’m looking forward to putting out more tracks soon!
Huge thank you to Lynds for the tutorial series on Youtube as well as Resolute Kraken, Red Rider & Agitato for the track building tools and assets!

items.title: 2016 Lacr Mx Slabz710
items.creator: DirtScooter
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Instructions
2016 LACR MX – SLABZ710
My first release in over a year, I decided to give back to the community. I was asked to make this track by E-Dawg69 and D1rty202, so thanks to them for the idea! With over 400 hours of work into this map, I hope you enjoy it as much as we do.
I have never rode in California, so it’s bit harder for me to get the “feel” you all get when riding there. The look of the tracks are Prepped and Watered, with deform from a short amount of riding.
The Main track has Gates and Lap timing, but the Vet track does
NOT.
One section of the Vet Track is fun, but unpractical so that’s why I did not add lap times. The ‘Rookie White’ Section is either a
triple
or
quad
, and doubling feels too small for MX Bikes. It was hard for me to make it proper especially with new Bikes coming soon..
40 Pits
24 Gates
Special Thanks:
IDEA & TESTING:
D1rty202, Edawg69, DAMO, Just Goon It, The Den
OBJECTS:
Paramoto910 – Water Tanks & Vehicles
TRACK TOOLS & TIPS:
Resolute Kraken, TFC, EarthWurx
If you would like to Donate, There is a link down below to my PayPal. But, I intended it to be free. 😎

items.title: Alpine Trails
items.creator: sixtyfour
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Bring a jacket and explore the frozen alpine wilderness! With over 6,500m of interconnected trails built to be ridden in either direction, these mountains are easy to get lost in. After my first track awhile back, I wanted to try my hand at something larger scale.
In the spawn area you’ll find a trails map, with the (timed) outer loop being highlighted in blue. While it can be ridden both directions, timing goes southward from the finish line (starting in the 4 way intersection, head towards the finish). Additionally there are blue signs that indicate that you are on the outer loop, and if they are on your right side, you are heading in the right direction for timing. I’ve also added additional indication signs for blind corners, intersections, and the path to take to stay on the outer loop when the trail splits.
You’ll also notice 2 different skies in the screenshots. The blue sky is on clear/rainy conditions, and the northern lights are on the cloudy conditions. Overall the trails are relatively easy, I was aiming for a relaxing hold RT experience. There is some roughness in some areas though, so pushing for time isn’t incredibly easy.
Massive thanks to Red, not only for assets, but also for tips and suggestions for creating my own assets, as well as playtesting!
Enjoy!

items.title: The Moon Hole By J Pring My 1St Track
items.creator: J-PRING
items.description:
Description
Downloads
WELCOME TO
THE MOON HOLE
by J-PRING
Yes, that’s right! We are going to the MOON!
Here at SPACE MX we like to go big or go even bigger, and that’s why we need you! A test subjec *coughing*…a “Thrill Seeker!”  Destined to push the limits of what is possible! The track is located inside a 400m wide crater with features designed to test your skills and our new line of astronaut diapers (we expect you’ll “go big”). The locals have no understanding of what makes a good MX track but their services proved invaluable for the construction. This was their first go at it so you might see a few things that aren’t quite up to our standards here on earth.
Race Starts as soon as we land, watch your step, it’s a 130ft drop to the surface!
This track includes a 20-30 min enduro track that weaves its way around the crater. It starts (Green) near the center of the crater, simply follow the colored markers along the paths, changing colors as you pass different “Follow” signs indicating which color you need to follow next until you are back to the start.
THE TOWER CHALLENGE!!!
GOAL
: Reach the top!
RULES
:
Easy Mode
– You can set track markers only on the red platforms and you can only walk backwards on the obstacles.
Impossible Mode
– No resets, can only walk backwards on obstacles.
Author Notes:
Hello wonderful people! Thank you for checking out my track! This is a pretty massive accomplishment for myself 🙂 it is my first track and my first time making something for a videogame. After working on this track off and on for over 2 years, learning how everything works and a lot about how things don’t work 😛 I am proud to present to you my creation!!!
When I started this project with about 40 hours of playtime in MX bikes, I sucked at the game and hardly knew anything about track construction or how to make a good MX track. My first intention was to make an Enduro MX hybrid, a track that would push my skills at the time and make me better at the game. I’m now at 280 hours in game from almost exclusively testing this track (and having a blast doing it) and as my skills in the game got better so did my track building. I have learned a lot about what goes into making these tracks and there’s definitely a lot I would change but given that I’ve been working on this track for so long, I need to just get it out into the public and start working on the next track 😀
I made all my own assets for the track. The only things I didn’t make are the Company and Manufacturer Logos on the signs. I knew I wanted to have a crazy start to the track, something people haven’t seen before. My first thought was to have a dropship in the sky that the riders jump out of. I didn’t even know if this would be possible but after some testing I knew I could do it. I’m a fan of rockets and after seeing the development of Starship by SpaceX and their crazy tower catching concept, I had to make something inspired by it.
Overall I’m very happy with how everything turned out, it’s not perfect but I will just have to accept that 😛
As this is my first track I’m releasing it FOR FREE!!!! I want everyone to be able to enjoy this track and If you did enjoy it, please consider donating so I can buy sandwiches and make more tracks <3
Donation Link

must

items.title: One One Ranch
items.creator: RedRum Track Crew
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Hello, NewSkool here and welcome to the One-One Ranch! You may have seen the supercross tracks released by my solo account for the One-One Series. However, this will be the first official track release from the RedRum Track Crew, a combined effort of me (NewSkool) and Dr.PhDeez! Now, I started this track way back in March as a solo project of creating a One-One Compound. It has gone through several massive overhauls over the last few months, especially once Deez joined me.
This map features two tracks. The main MX track that is going to be round 5 of the One-One MX Series. Lap times sit around the 2 minute mark. There are 40 pits and 40 gates, so hosting a full lobby is possible! I also set up custom cameras, which makes streaming races and making edits extremely fun! There are multiple line selections throughout the track, making for some excellent racing and great passing opportunities. This track was designed for the 250, however I did do some testing on 125s and 450s. For those with experience on the 125, you can hit just about anything if you keep your speed up. The 450s are a tad overkill, but with proper throttle control and ability to scrub can be really fun as well!
The second track is an SX track. This track does not have any gates and is meant for practice on 125s and 250s. For those of you who rode round 9 of the One-One SX series, you will see a heavy resemblance. That is because we decided to take this track, scale it up properly for a SX race and adjusted it to be better for full racing. It is a solid track that helps for practicing your ability to be exact with your jumps and throttle control in the corners. It is also a heck of a lot of fun to do some 1v1 races with friends.
A massive shoutout to
RedRider for all his help and awesome assets
Kellz x Cody for the Tree Pack
Agitato for multiple assets
Phantomz for the skidsteer asset

items.title: Stewartmx
items.creator: jayMXB
items.description:
Description
Downloads
This is my first track in mx bikes!
I have built this track from scratch with some inspiration from schoolhousemx in the north-east uk, the layout is not the same as schoolhouse but it is similar and some features take inspiration from the track.
I have spent some time building this track but I have mainly focused on the riding aspects of the track as it is hard to find good textures and models. I also have 16gb of ram which is not enough to place a lot of objects in blender so I could only do a few trees.
I would love to hear some feedback for my track or some tips for the next time I build a track.
This track is best suited for the 450 but everything is doable on a 250.
thank you to everyone who downloads my track.
enjoy!

items.title: Steezy Mx Texas Smx 2024 V2
items.creator: Steezy Mx
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Instructions
Set Track Deformation to .50 or lower for best results.
Welcome to Version 2 (V2) Dallas/ Ft Worth Tx, Rd.2 of the 2024 SMX Playoffs by Steezy Studios. Regular gates this time, I was able to fit 28 which means I left the scaling exactly the same as version 1. I did this because it created an easier workflow in order to stay on track for Las Vegas.
With this version of Dallas Texas SMX Rd.2 I used the original layout that was first released to public. I also combined some features from the alternate map that they used Irl. The reason I combined both maps is because they both have great features, and I feel like this is what the Texas SMX track should have been.
These tracks are built in less than a week, but I still do my best to deliver a decent track and a preview of what to expect. Again, track scaling is larger than IRL but not by much. Unfortunately, I had already placed my track objects/ Curves before realizing I was slightly over scaled, and it can be a real pain fixing objects afterwards.
If for some reason the Track/ Rider Pkz doesn’t work, then use the WinRAR folder and it should work then. Not sure why it’s doing this. You can also use the Skyboxes and any other info you need in the WinRAR file. Other than that, I believe I’ve worked all the bugs out but if there are any issues, please let me know and I’ll be sure to fix asap. Thanks, and I hope you enjoy this newer version of the track.

items.title: Cedarwood Circuit
items.creator: sixtyfour
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Cedarwood Circuit, my first track. It took a few weeks of trial and error until I got something I was somewhat happy with. There’s a few things I’d do differently, and a lot of things I’ve learned that I will be putting to use in future releases. I tried to go for a vibrant, colorful woods track that was somewhere in-between beginner and intermediate, in addition to having different viable lines. My best time is around 01:11, but I’m still fairly new to the game and I’m sure there’s plenty of room for improvement. Timing is good to go from my tests but if something is off please let me know.
Big thanks to:
Totes MickGoats, PunkerJeffy, and Mouse for answering my questions and providing tips
Red for track assets as well as also providing support
Resolute Kraken for the tools to bring everything together
My buddy Danny for the endless playtests
Enjoy!

First crack at track building and designing! Its not pretty but it does work. I wanted to build a track from skratch and look forward to doing way more in the future.
I was not the biggest fan of the lay out but after spending many hours learning the process and all of the different programs I didn’t want it to go to waste.
The track has enough room for 22 racers in the pits and gate. All the timing gates do work and it is raceable with friends!
BIGGGG shout out to Lynds and his videos on the track building process.
It does work, fun on both the 250 and 450.

items.title: Orchard Farms Mx One One Mx R1
items.creator: Dr.PhDeez
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Update! Thank you for all of your feedback. I kept the crowd noise but it is now much, much lower, more of an ambient background noise now to still give the track some life. Shouldn’t be able to hear it over the bike noises unless you really listen for it. Server file will be updated as well! Please redownload.
Join the One-One SMX crew on Monday, Sept. 2, 2024 for the first round of our 2024 250 MX series at
Orchard Farms MX
, based in Eldridge California! If you want race this track, find the One-One server or myself on Discord and we’ll help get you signed up. We accept any level of rider, from beginner to pro, so don’t be shy!
This is my very
first track release
and I’m excited to share it with you all. This track is a remake of one of the first conceptual tracks I built in MXGP2020,
featured by windam151
. It only made sense to bring it to MX Bikes.
I put a lot of time and effort into building this track to have great visuals, fun elevation changes, multiple lines, ruts in the jump faces and corners, along with actual physical texture in the terrain. The addition of the physical texture is minimal, but seems to help with traction and makes the track feel a bit more realistic. Overall, it’s a great track for intermediate riders, and allows some flexibility for newer riders to learn on without being too difficult. This track is built for a 250, but is a lot of fun on a 350/450 as well.
This track will also be available on the server list, so feel free to run it!
Special thanks –
One-One SMX crew for letting me practice texturing in the SX series leading to creating R1 for the MX series
NewSkool for helping me learn the ins and outs of track building
Lynds, RedRider, Resolute Kraken, AGMX, Giopanda, Mouk Lab, Kellz, Cody James, PHANTOMZ, TFC, Navo, L0wpoly and anyone else I forgot for their awesome tutorials, assets, and whatever else got me this point. Couldn’t have made this without you all!

PLA Enduro Comp
Welcome to the PLA Enduro compound!!! A massive experience to scratch that enduro itch!!!Filled with tons of hill climbs and 100% rideable rocks that you do not get stuck in!!! I have spent an unhealthy amount of time on this so please if you enjoy let me know!!! Also please explore and enjoy the track it is meant to be ridden!! ride the trails and don’t stick to the main marked one it can be a lot of fun!
SIDE NOTE: logs was a plan, but my pc started crashing when trying to implement them so I’m sad to release it without it
Would be fun to get it onto the servers so please if you can get it into the servers do so!!!
basic info!
*2 very fun rideable rock gardens!!
*Many hill climbs to satisfy your need to technical hills (there are 2 that are extremely difficult so if you see a hill climb just off the trail, I recommend you attempt it just to see what I mean!!!
*Fast passed and slowed down wood’s sections!!
*When entering the rock garden sit a gear higher and just get playful in the rocks hit them and don’t try and go around them because they can be sooo fun when you hit a flow state
*A main marked loop (don’t need to stay on the marked loop to have fun)
I could go on all day, but I want ya riding heres some pictures!!!

items.title: One One Smx Round 10 Sx Finale Las Vegas
items.creator: NewSkool
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Welcome to the 10th and final round of the One-One SMX 250 SX Championship! With this race we wrap up what has been an extremely fun supercross series and get ready for our outdoors portion of our SMX Championship! If you love supercross and would like to join, find me on discord and I will help get you signed up for mondays race!
Before we get to the track, I just want to thank everyone who has played these tracks over the last few months. It has been a really tough process trying to make tracks that are different and fun for everyone. While some of the tracks may have had issues, I really appreciate you guys for giving them a shot. There is no better feeling as a creator than people enjoying the tracks we release.
Just like before, the awesome textures all come from DR.PhDeez! He has been absolutely crucial in these last few rounds looking so much better!
Now for what you are all here for, a run down of the track and a few pictures to show off what we have for you!
The first feature you can see is the awesome split start outside of the stadium. Half the field will go right and the other half will go left. They then come back together inside the stadium for a long rhythm up the middle.
The second feature is a split rhythm section. Going into the corner you have to set up for which lane you want. They are pretty even timing wise, so its all about how fast you can hit them!
The third feature is specific for the race this monday. We will be using a joker lane for this race! Now, there isn’t a specifically built joker lane. For this race, one time during each moto, the rider must take a left after the over under jump and circle around the start straight and merge back how they would have on the start. It adds about 13-14 seconds to the lap. This is not required if playing on your own or in your own server, this is specific to the One-One series race!
The last feature for this track has nothing to do with racing! To make this a tad more special we have added an extra feature to the track. I know a lot of people will scoff at the file size, which I can understand. However, that was necessary in order for me to add this. Outside of the stadium by the pits, the first thing you will see when you spawn is a full length straight rhythm! Not to mention several fmx jumps headed the other direction so you can throw some nasty tricks while headed back to the start!
Massive shoutout to RedRider for all his advice and assets! This community would be so empty without him here.
Massive shoutout again to Dr.PhDeez for all his help!
Shout out to NKSTUF for the curved flag assets!
Shout out to theFluffygecko for his FMX assets!
Lastly, another massive thanks from the RedRum Track Crew to you guys! Thank you all for playing and enjoying these tracks. We have some more projects in the works for the rest of the year! Not to mention the stuff being planned out already for next year!

items.title: Mxcite Bike Stadium
items.creator: eraaks212
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Hello Everyone,
Welcome to MxCite Bike Stadium! I had a great time making this build, and was a passion project of mine to do. I hope you like it. This track is my first full SX track I’ve ever built. Now is when you say, “Didn’t you make the SX prep tracks in 2023?” Yes, but those weren’t meant to be raced on, more track map preview’s.
Alright, so obviously this is inspired by a certain NES game. I wanted the obstacles to be as close as possible to the game but also compatible with MxBikes. This track was tested primarily with the 450 which I recommend. It is ridable with a 250, but the big lines aren’t possible.
OBSTACLES:
The jumps are oversized, peaky, and also feature flat tops to mimic the game. I also put some lips on the tables to make them on/offs. I did try doing the orangish color with white faces and green backsides but it looked too strange texture wise.
Track Features:
Pixelized most of the decals, objects to try to give it a retro theme. The bales DO NOT have collisions, but if you cut through them you will get cuts so watch the boundaries. 20 gates, 20 pits, fully working camera’s. Skybox is styled after a retro game. Grass is also meant to mimic the game.
SOIL:
I made the decision to keep the soil type as SOIL. This is done to make the track technical, and keep riders honest with the obvious big lines caused by the large obstacles of the track. So, this means when you fall (which you will eventually) it will take some finesse to get going.
Want to help support?
Race in the Red Stars Racing Series on MyMXB starting August 17th! These will be featuring my recent MNSR Series of tracks which you can find on
the Mx Bikes Shop.
THANK YOU TO:
Red Rider – For all the help you’ve given me, the objects, and testing over the years. LEGEND.
Earth Wurx – Thank you for letting me join the group! I appreciate all the nuggets of information, assistance, and help to push me into making higher quality tracks.
KeLLz – For the advice, help, tutorials, and answers to my many questions.
Slabz – Worker Objects
Smoksta – For helping test! (His video is in here somewhere)
Lynds – For helping with the track name

items.title: Quarry Basin Ish From Mx Vs Atv Alive
items.creator: mtb4life
items.description:
Description
Downloads
I am of the possibly unpopular opinion that MX vs. ATV Alive was an easy top 3 in the series, and have a lot of great memories from playing it. Quarry basin was easily one of my favorite tracks in the game and I can’t quite put my finger on why, but when I decided I wanted to give track building a go, I figured, why not try and do a replica of a track I spent hours on in the past.
I entered the process thinking it would be somewhat straight forward, as I didn’t have to replicate much in the terms of roughness or ruts, but quickly realized I was in for a struggle. After my first attempt at a heightmap, I realized I would not be able to scale the track anywhere close to the original map in order for it to ride the same in bikes. Many features of what I have created vary significantly from the original game, hence the title of the track being Quarry basin (Ish). The overall layout is similar to the original Quarry basin, but the jumps, scaling and even the corners have been altered a ton. A prime example being the hip jump, which originally pulled almost a 180.
I think the track has many aspects that could be improved on, but I think it is in a state which is very fun to ride, with different lines, which are close in times through each section. My approach to the track was to test and scale it so that a 250 could make every jump, but had to stretch many of the jumps. I am of the opinion that it is pretty beginner friendly, but an intermediate rider can practice their timings in order to really optimize their lap times.
I want to give a massive thank you to KingMX818 for showing me many tips and tricks within the entire process and being patient despite my endless questions.
Also, thank you to the boys (you know who you are), the whole SHG team and others who helped give their thoughts, test ride and help me with understanding the track building process.

items.title: Across The Sea
items.creator: punkerjeffy
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Instructions
Welcome to Across The Sea. It’s set on an uninhabited island in the Mediterranean Sea somewhere near Greece. It’s a full sand track and overall it’s pretty rough and challenging. I like using higher fidelity foliage but because of the amount I needed I created low poly assets for it so hopefully the frame rates are fine. I spent time making sure all 3 environments (sunny, cloudy, rainy) look good and I usually prefer riding it when it’s cloudy. I’ve started learning some new tools and techniques and personally I think this is my best work to date but you guys can be the judges. As usual I tested this mostly on the 450 and the 250 will really need to be stretched on some of the jumps. My best time is about a 2:34 but I’m sure there’s a ton of room for improvement.
Thanks to:
Resolute Kraken because I probably wouldn’t be building tracks if it wasn’t for his tools
Totes McGoats for testing and lots of back and forth on improving our techniques
NuggetBoi for being very gracious with his time helping me test
I don’t plan to try and release paid tracks in the future because I really enjoy the process. While I don’t expect donations, you can Venmo me at Jeff-Gunderson-6 if you really feel the need.
Enjoy!

items.title: Alaskan Freeride Snocross
items.creator: DevoPROCworks
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Welcome to
Alaskan Freeride
A fun riding area with tons of shoveled and natural terrain jumps along a snowmobile trail loop based in Alaska.
Real height map data from a very popular Freeride spot of Turnagain Pass Alaska, was used for my base before adding many fun riding features
Hangout at the Parking lot and hit some Freestyle ramps by the Shop/Lodge. You’ll find a few of these hauled into the hills across the map.
Out in the hills, you’ll find alot of shovel hits, there are so many freeride lines to come up with.
The trail loop isn’t very long, or much too special. But it will take you to or near almost every riding spot throughout the map.
To complete a lap time you will need to go through the parking lot. I didn’t focus at all on racing here so I never bothered to fix it.
Not all the jumps hit like butter. Some you may have to work for, gas out or hit with a more calculated approach,
To find that sweet spot of a landing.
Paramoto910 swung by to check out this F14 Tomcat tail we found. He then of coarse shoveled  a hit over it! Then proceeded to leave his Red Rev behind, after getting it stuck. Legend says its still out there.
(Credits to Paramoto910 for the F14 Tail model)
There are some tricky big steppers that’s for sure.
I could have done more to this map but decided to focus on my next Track instead, this was mainly used for a test facility for the “Snocross Mod” Physics, and as practice for building realistic feeling locations.
I Hope you enjoyed the map, i love hearing the feedback and content. Also the slight teaser within the photo’s of our new upcoming Snocross chassis. The
REV-DOO 600RS COMING SOON!
Drag .pkz into motocross folder. Server .PKZ also included.

items.title: Straight Rhythm Gra Edition
items.creator: insane
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Welcome to the first contribution of the “Geringverdiener ([
ɡəˈʁɪŋfɛɐ̯ˌdiːnɐ
]
Geringverdiener
) Racing Association”.
This is obviously just fun. But we also had a funny evening where we decided to host a little 12 man Straight Rhythm event. Sadly the current Straight Rhythm implementation isn’t the best for that case so here I am with a dirty fix.
The track is called “Straight Rhythm GRA” in game, so you can use it parallel to the already existing stock track.
The centerline is untouched, only thing I changed to make it a better experience was:
Removed the straight_rhythm value, so it’s possible to practice during an online session, and for all the other things to work
Moved start/finish right after the drop-off, so the lap starts counting once you left the podium
Split 1 is untouched and Split 2 is now the new “finish” – this is mandatory for qualifying laps (more later on)
Added some layout objects to make it the real deal, to prevent collisions in pits ect. and to display the “rules” I came up with in less than 3 minutes
How to play it:
On the track there’s multiple “rule books”. Read and obey them!
Best experience is to be in a voice chat with all contestants, someone has to moderate it, be admin in the server and work out a Google or Excel sheet, for example:
The server MUST have collisions disabled! This is mandatory, otherwise the game or server will crash. Reason below.
The contestants should either do their qualifying laps (decide for a time, start a new practice or actual qualifying session, then everyone has 3 tries) or you go by list and do it manually
For a qualifying lap to count, the contestant has to start a lap, ride the track, return, and jump off/start a new lap to finish the previous one and write data to the session. That way the host/moderator can see the S2 time and transfer that over to the sheet.
So S2 time = time from drop off to finish arch
Once the qualifying is done, the host/moderator has to prepare the groups.
THIS IS IMPORTANT!!
Once the groups are set, the riders have to pick their gates according their position in the groups. So say Group 1, Player 1 picks gate 1. Player 2 picks gate 2. Group 4, Player 1 has to pick gate 7!
That way you make sure that the contestants are on the opposite line. This has to be repeated for each advanced round.
If everyone picked their gate, the host/moderator starts the race session.
ONLY
the currently active group is allowed to race!
EVERYONE
else has to go to replay and watch that race! This is real fun, especially stressing for the current riders as everyone is looking at them. The track has an awesome auto-cam and also a side drone, which looks really cool aswell.
After a race:
Host/moderator writes down who won, and then either the group that finished right now continues with the next match, or the next group starts so it’s not too boring for everyone. This is up to you.
Make sure everyone has their gates, then start a practice session and once that’s loaded start the race session. Again, only the currently active group is allowed to race, everyone else go grab that camera.
First who won 2 matches in a group advances to next round. Then there’s 1/4 finale, 1/2 finale, finale… or whatever you’re up to.
Known bugs:
The added objects should be collidable, for some reason they’re not like they’ve been back then. I will probably update the track once PiBoSo explained to me how or if it should work, we’ll see.
Sometimes the gates get messed up. The track comes with 20 gates (10 left, 10 right), so if someone isn’t able to get the picked gate, try some that are not used by other players.
Wait, 20 gates, 10 left, 10 right. Wdym bro?
In order to fully work, there’s 10 gates overlapping each other so those who are in the active group are definitely able to race. I can’t  explain it really, but this is how I figured it out. So make sure opponents are definitely on the opposite of each others, so one has the left gate and the other has the right gate.
I hope you kinda got my idea and I explained it ok enough for anyone to understand. If not, we are probably going to stream an evening and show exactly how we have thought it through. Sounds confusing at first but it’s definitely only the first time that it’s confusing.
Wish you good battles and let’s hope to make Straight Rhythm great again!

items.title: Milton Downs Huge Air Hill
items.creator: subtsub
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Welcome to Milton Downs MX (nicknamed Huge Air Hill), my third track creation – this time with a real focus on texturing, environment and elevation!
Again, I’m very happy to get any feedback you have on it for future releases as it’s been a learning experience the whole way through (I’m a YouTuber, I can handle feedback!)
This track is built for OEM MX1 / MX1 2T built for 450s, I actually don’t think one section is doable on any OEM MX2s given the torque requirement to get up the Milton hills, but I’m willing to be proven wrong!
This track is all about sending it, throwing some fat whips and scrubs, hitting huge lines, and getting the track as rough as possible through the incredibly aggressive erode. If you don’t like erode, turn it down before you go riding!
I hope you enjoy riding it as much as I enjoyed making it!
Ps: couple easter eggs out there for you to enjoy
Pss: this track was made with livestream elimination races in mind… hence the start directly into finish!
Psss: next thing I’ll be working on is making a bumpier track, appreciate it’s quite smooth generally!
HUGE shout out to these people:
Red Rider – for most of the assets used

Welcome to Round 9 or the One-One SMX 250 SX Series! We are almost done with our SX side of our championship, so don’t miss out and come on over! We accept all skill levels so no excuses! For those who qualify for the SMX Playoffs at the end of the outdoor series, there will be something special for you! So if you like stuff, get in here and lets go! Just find me on Discord through one of the many MXBikes related groups and I will help you get signed up!
I really want to start out by shoutout our texture man DR.PHDEEZ, he has done a phenomenal job ever since he started helping me out with these and this week is no different. The textures are amazing and add a level of detail I could never achieve. So a huge thanks to him for this!
This track is very flowy and has some easier to hit rhythms as well as some big boy lines. I can see lap times getting down into the 55s and 56s for those at higher skill levels. Do be careful in the whoops, the textures aren’t just a visual addition. They are physical so if you go into the whoops sideways you might find yourself in trouble!
Huge shoutout to RedRider as always. His advice and assets are what make this possible for me!
Big shoutout to Agitato for his holeshot sign.
Thanks to PHANTOMZ for his skid steer asset
Also a shoutout to JANES46 for the skydome
Lastly, if you run into any problems please let me know! I can’t fix something if I don’t know its broken!

items.title: Buck House
items.creator: subtsub
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Welcome to Buck House MX, my second ever track creation – this time learning how to make tracks with elevation!
Again, I’m very happy to get any feedback you have on it for future releases as it’s been a learning experience the whole way through (I’m a YouTuber, I can handle feedback!)
Track’s built for 450s, but if you’re pinned you can have a great time stretching out the jumps on a 125!
Please do search for some of the big lines on 450s – there are a few, but I’m not that quick, so I’m sure you could do even more ridiculous things…
I hope you enjoy riding it as much as I enjoyed making it!
Note: erode is quite strong, just how I like it, so if that’s not your preference, turn it down!
HUGE shout out to these people:
Red Rider – for most of the assets used
Kellz & Cody – for the trees and bushes
Giopanda – for the stakes and a couple of other little assets
Agitato – for basically all of the other assets
Nkstuf – more assets
Navo – even more assets
Lynds – for the tutorial vids which I put countless hours into watching
Resolute Kraken – you should all know why
Pics below:
Enjoy!

items.title: Lost Horizon
items.creator: SpringMx
items.description:
Description
Downloads
In a desolate, post-apocalyptic landscape where the sun sets behind jagged, crumbling horizons, a forgotten motocross track lies dormant. Once a bustling arena of adrenaline and cheers, it now echoes with the whispers of winds sweeping through rusted buildings and overgrown trails. The track, encircled by twisted metal and remnants of a lost civilization, stands as a stark reminder of a world that once was, now reclaimed by nature’s relentless march. Amidst the silence, the faint traces of tire marks etched into the earth tell stories of past glories, as if waiting for the day when engines will roar back to life, resurrecting the thrill in this forsaken expanse.
*Track name in game –  Smx_LostHorizon

items.title: Smokstas Headquarters
items.creator: SmokstaJ
items.description:
Description
Downloads
UPDATED!
Added a link to my google drive, because certain people are not able to download from Mediafire!
Today I am proud to release my first track for MX Bikes! I have been working on this project daily for the last month, with so much help from some amazing individuals including, Kewin Fuela, SB Suki, Red Rider, Fluke Creations, and King MX. Thanks to these individuals i was able to get my track to a place where I am comfortable releasing it!  If it wasn’t for these guys I would never have been able to reach a quality in which i am happy with! So thank you! Also I want to say thank you to everyone in the Earthwurx Discord who have been very friendly and welcoming! I am going to keep working on tracks and perfecting what ive learned to hopefully reach a position in which I can consistently create quality tracks! I also want to say thank you to all of my subscribers on youtube, for your constant support, and praise, if it wasnt for you guys, I would have never started this journey!
NKSTUF – Curved Banners
Red Rider – EZ Up Tents, Water, and Dump Trucks, and all of his assistance through tutorials, and Voice Chat Guidance!
Kellz & Cody – Y Tree Pack
Agitato – Archways, and banners
Kewin Fuela – Continued assistance and voice chat support, and help with diagnosing problems, as well as teaching me Norms, Edge Maps, and AOs, YOUR THE MAN KEWIN!
SB SUKI – Thank you for your support, and assistance through voice chat, teaching me blender, and being a genuinely great person! I would have never got the trees, and banners placed without you!
Fluke Creations – Thank you for your support, and answering any questions i had, no matter how annoying i was
King MX – Thank you for your support, and showing me how to use L3DT, and Helping me Figure out my issues, with Daylon Leveller!
Earthwurx – Thank you for allowing me to join, and showing me your support while assisting me with assets and feedback!
VMVisuals – for creating my thumbnail and taking the beautiful screenshots of my track!
Noswad, Up2Late, OGsteezus – for testing and feedback, as well as being great friends, and always showing your support!
If i forgot anyone, i apologize, remind me and I will update this post!
Subscribe to my youtube channel –
https://www.youtube.com/@smoksta

Instructions
Well everyone I got to finally uploading this track to all of you, this track does have timing gates but in real life the starts you see on this track do not exist so I had to get creative. This track is not the best you’ll see on mxb-mods but I have tried my best, I am trying though to produce more higher quality and more flowy tracks for you all to play,  I have been asking questions, trying new methods and programs and overall getting out of my comfort zone and testing new ways to build track and one day ill make a ripper track for you all to enjoy.  just gotta give me some time😂.
A MASSIVE THANK YOU TO THE FOLLOWING:
I want to give a big thank you to Red Rider, He has helped me through the entire process of getting this track done, from tips in blender to how to make stuff in photoshop, he has not only helped me with multiple things but also listened and answered to any question I had to ask and never getting annoyed (I hope haha)
Another big thankyou to Pirata for helping me with objects and building the amazing replica of the in real life house you see in the thumbnail.
And lastly another big thanks to Matrica from EarthWurx for giving me a tutorial of the basics of building a jump gradient in photo shop.
(I i have missed anyone please let me know in the comments or message me through mxb-mods and ill update the post as soon as i can thanks.)

items.title: One One Smx Round 8 Arlington
items.creator: NewSkool
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Hello and welcome to Round 8 of the One-One SMX 250 Championship! We are starting to draw near the end of the SX portion of this series! This time we bring you a major mix-up with addition of a mudder! So if that sounds interesting, find me on discord and I’ll help get you signed up! We don’t care what your skill level is, come join us for some fun gate drops! Racing starts at 9pm central on Monday nights!
Due to the weather, the track was cut down just like they tend to do in IRL in order to make the track actually ridable. That being said, qualifying made the track quite rutted already, so there is a level of difficulty added simply by that. Racing should be tight and fun, just keep that back wheel planted so you don’t go down!
For those of you racing this on your own, make sure to turn the rain on in order to really get a feel for what this track was designed for!
This track idea for the mud would not have been possible without the skills of DR.PHDEEZ who handled all of the textures and masks! I have to say it looks phenomenal in game and really looks extremely muddy! So a big thanks for all his help!
Lastly, a huge shoutout to RedRider for all his awesome track assets. Also a big thanks to thefluffygecko for the fmx ramps!

Hello Fellow MXBikers!
Its my pleasure to be submitting another track.
This time i’d like to present my fourth ever track..

I came up with this track at

and made this whole thing in
one day
which is an achievement for me.
For future tracks they will be made with much more care so i made more quality and not quantity tracks.

offers a
nice easy track to ride on

little bit of roughnes
s to it so its not perfectly flat.
it also is situated next to a
beach
so get your swimming trunks ready.

and pits for you and your friends to enjoy.

And that’s surprisingly it.
Anyways i hope you enjoy my track,
so as always.
good luck and have fun.

HOWS IT GOING EVERYONE!!!
What you are about to ride is Round 9 of IBSKELSO’s Series called Kelso Cup. This week we have a very INTENSE, FUN, DIFFERENT and VERY DIFFICULT, TECHNICAL Raceday version track. This track is a little bit upscaled from my others and more smooth in my opinion and will take more skill timing jumps better and being consistent  All jumps are custom made meaning i used no template to add a fully new riding experience and style to have a great time and or race with your friends. To my knowledge The remainder of the Kelso Cup Rounds are most likely going to be held on mymxb, So make sure you guys sign up for future races if not already. 1 more round to go..

items.title: One One Smx Round 7 Nashville
items.creator: NewSkool
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Hello and welcome to Nashville for Round 7 of the One-One Designs SMX Championship SX Series! I am really excited to bring you this one for multiple reasons! This race is in honor of the St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital! A lot of love from the One-One Team to all the workers who bring joy and healing to children and their families!
This series is open to anyone who would like to join! While racing has been on Wednesdays over the last 6 weeks, moving forward we will be racing on Monday nights at 9PM Central Time. So if that lines up with your schedule and you are interested in racing, Find the One-One Discord or message me on here for an invite! We accept all skill levels, so no excuses! Come join us for some fun gate drops and shenanigans!
For those of you who have been enjoying my tracks so far, I’m sure you already notice a big difference this week. For the first time in the series, the awesomeness that is DR.PHDEEZ has offered to help me with the tracks moving forward. His texture skills have added a new element to these tracks and they look absolutely amazing! So a massive shoutout to him for all this help.
Just as always, a massive shoutout to RedRider for all his amazing advice and awesome track assets. These tracks wouldn’t be possible if it weren’t for them!

items.title: Steezy93 Julien Liebers Practice Track
items.creator: Steezy93
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Hello this is my 3rd track release – this one is a replica of Julien Liebers practice track located in Belgium. You might remember the epic gopro videos of it on youtube from about 10 years ago. Its a very gnarly small overgrown track with muddy ruts, puddles of water, lots of elevation changes. It is raceable, there are 24 gates which will be extremely hectic and hopefully a lot of fun. For the first lap only you must go straight – do not take the first right turn, every lap after take the right turn with the large single rut immediately after passing the start straight.
it works best on 250cc bikes.
Being one of my tracks there are also a number of freeride jumps located around the map.
For this release I improved my fake ruts, learned how to add water and water reflections.
Rain weather is a cool vibe on this track give it a shot.
It is free but donations are appreciated greatly
I hope you enjoy –
Credits – Kellz and cody tree pack, Agitato banners, skybox from  Openfootage . net

items.title: 2015 Ernee Mxdn
items.creator: Mulock22
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Here It Is:
It’s been a long year since Fernley, and I started on this basically right after that release and last year’s OEM drop. I wanted something challenging in MXB, something as accurate to IRL as I could muster, and something new to push myself (boy did I find that). So I got to thinking, and remembered this aggravating course from one of the MXGP games. The hills, the patience to go fast, the risk of crashing off a mountain, but in MXB. This project has been through a lot of changes, with me joining both the ARL and OEM teams and having my full focus split between however many projects both in game and IRL.
This is based on the 2015 MX des Nations, moto 2 videos. It’s tight, it’s technical, the berms/ruts hook and vanish. You won’t have a good time if you just try to pin it 5th WFO everywhere. There’s steep hills, with turns, and ruts, and roughness. The perfect MXB experience, if you ask me.
Some pics of deform:
Thanks to everyone involved:
RedRider, Ryan Cardno, JV, Agitato, D.Alves, RossHell, FatMuppet, (anyone else I couldn’t find credits for) – Assets
EarthWurx (you know who you are) – testing, feedback, frens, tips, advice, etc
Alpha – release screens, testing, feedback
My cats – always being on my desk and giving me something to yell at when blender is frustrating me
Piboso / Snappe – the game
MXB-MODS/OEM Team – you already know, and if you don’t then just come back when v18 drops 😉

The

is one of the fastest bikes in the game but you never see it on the servers because no tracks are sized for a bike with this kind of power. That is why I decided to build a track scaled for the Varg in alpha mode. It also works with 450’s. This is an easier flowy track with a few serious booters. There a multiple lines to hit everywhere to keep times competitive.
Brushed Concrete Design
The track texture will look like concrete that was just poured and brushed, giving it a darker and more malleable affect.

items.title: One One Smx Round 6 Iowa City
items.creator: NewSkool
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Welcome to round 6 of the One-One Designs SMX 250 Championship Series! This time around we find ourselves in Iowa City for what is sure to be an exciting race! We found ourselves a new winner in round 5, so the points are getting tighter!
If joining the series sounds fun, find me on discord (NewSkool) and I will get you into the discord so you can join! We don’t care what your skill level is. Come and join us for some exciting gate drops!
For round 6, I backed away from a lot of the different features that I’ve used in prior rounds. Though I did sort of snag an idea from Reflex for those that might remember. While the track isn’t extremely difficult, some sections can be tricky and require some throttle control. There are a couple of different line choices that are viable and even some big lines if you can pull them off that can save a ton of time.
I hope you enjoy the track, and as always I love feedback. I know I’m not the best creator around but I feel like I grow with each track I release. Feedback really helps me grow and fix issues as I move forward.
As always, massive shoutout to RedRider for all the awesome track objects and all his advice and tips! They mean so much to mean and have helped me a ton!

items.title: Nuggetboi Msc Kleinhau Nightcross
items.creator: NuggetBoi
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Hello, I’m NuggetBoi and I proudly present you Kleinhau! It’s another replica of an iconic german track in my region. The Nighttimecross Race held here is one of the biggest Oldtimer Events in Europe. I personally hate riding here (cause lack of Skill) so i thought, i should share my pain with this community 😀
The track has 40 Gates. As you can see by the Map, the start has a different line than the usual track layout. Had to move the Finish Line to make this work. Since on Bielstein some bigger races were held, I did a full Camera Set for this track. This time cuts and timing gates are not as harsh as on Bielstein 🙂
As usual, i tested the track on all OEM Bikes. Like Bielstein some parts are a little more difficult on a 250 but still all doable. If you want to go for Hotlaps I recommend using a Reshade that increases Brightness and Contrast. The track erodes a little weird (visually) because I did the Texturing a little differently to look more like Nighttime.
Photos
Special Thanks to
Slingela (<3)
redrider197
CodyJames
Phantomz

items.title: One One Smx Round 5 Green Bay
items.creator: NewSkool
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Hello! NewSkool here to announce round 5 of the One-One Designs SMX 250 Championship! Through 4 rounds the racing has been awesome and I’m sure it will only get better. Sign ups are open now for this round. So if you are interested in racing, Please find me on discord and I will get you into the disc so you can sign up. We accept anyone from any skill range, don’t miss out because you think you may be too good or not good enough. Come and enjoy some fun gate drops!
I’m starting to experiment with new templates and jumps. I think it worked out pretty well. However, if you notice anything that feels off please let me know so I can take the advice with me as I continue to build these tracks. I appreciate all honest and sincere thoughts!
Huge shoutout to RedRider for all the amazing advice and Assets he provides the community.

items.title: Procworks Snocross Rd 4 The Pit
items.creator: DevoPROCworks
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Welcome to the PROCworks SNOCROSS Championship RD.4
at “The PIT”
Based on a Local Motocross Track I grew up riding at Outside Thamesford, Ontario Canada. Many calls and talks with the owners to host a Snocross Practice day to no avail, so here we are doing so in MXBikes!
A large freeride area built into and out of a quarry, full of many natural, shoveled or ramp hits!
Built around all current Snocross Chassis’s available for download!
Jumping in and out of all the elevation changes makes for some fun fast Racing!
Full Replay Cameras for broadcasting, with track and pit sound effects
Custom Snocross Team Semi Textures and Pits!
Theres a couple real big booters to hit in the freeride area!
Alot of effort was put into creating a realistic environment for this track! Multiple snow depth layers of textures until you hit the grass or dirt! I Really gotta thank everybody for the support on this new Class of racing! A few more rounds will be completed to finish off the series along with a couple more Snowmobile Chassis.
I hope you enjoy the track and leave a comment!
Thank You to the Earthwurx team for any needed help on these projects in track building!
Thank to to these Asset Creators
Kogan – Earthwurx Inflatable
RedRider197 – Semi pack, SX Bales, Earthwurx Machines, Pit Swag
Slabz – Marshalls, Restrooms
Agitato – Archways, Holeshot, Banners
Thatfluffygecko – Crowds
Dylan44Frisch – Flagger Stands
KELLZ and Cody’s –  Tree Pack
Rosshell – MXGP Pits (Re-Textured)

items.title: The Oa
items.creator: punkerjeffy
items.description:
Description
Downloads
This is a track I originally made for Reflex which is set in an oasis somewhere in the middle of the desert. I started with the base height map and made a lot changes to make it ride right for this game and changed up a few sections too. Everything else has been built from scratch. This is another track I spent a crazy amount of time on so I hope you guys like it. I spent a lot of the time working on texturing techniques and I’m really happy how this one turned out. I mostly tested with the KTM 450 but it rides well for 250s as well. My fastest lap is a 1:48 but there’s a lot of room for improvement so I’ll be interested to see what a real fast lap looks like.
Thanks to:

items.creator: ConsumingClouds
items.description:
Description
Downloads
The X Games is an extreme sports competition in the US that was much bigger in the early 2000’s but they still do the event every year to this day. This is the Freestyle Motocross course, but the IRL even also includes skateboarding, rallyx, bmx, a whole winter sports event with snowboarding and freestyle snowmobiles and in the summer event they used to do street luge and supermoto and much more, this event is incredible and it should be bigger than the olympics.
In the pit area I included an art gallery consisting of art from the MXBikes community.
There is a hidden whoops track under the stands of the stadium to test your suspension.
I hope you all have fun.

I want to start out by saying that I appreciate everyone’s help and support through this track building journey I have been on. It started out just wanting to build my local track and now I have several. All of the overwhelming positive feedback from everyone in the community as just been unreal and is what has driven me to keep making them. I am blessed to have such great supporters help me through this process, whether you are a Youtuber or another track creator that has showed me tips and trick THANK YOU! My Biggest Thanks has to go to RedRider197! He has gotten me where I am today. Please if you can go show him some love and support him. This track is much like my other tracks. Taylored to the casual player that likes to just spin some laps with out much of a struggle and just have some fun. I hope you guys enjoy this and hope to see it in some servers!

items.title: One One Smx Round 3 Annapolis
items.creator: NewSkool
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Hello! Welcome to Round 3 of the One-One SMX Supercross Series! This week we are honoring all of the Vets out there and bringing awareness to veteran suicide. After the racing we will be posting a link on our discord for anyone who would like to donate to the cause!
Racing so far has been phenomenal and is only going to get better! If you are interested in joining this series please message me and I will send you the discord for the series! Keep in mind, I’m still a new track builder, so if you have any tips or tricks that could help me out, I’m all ears! This track runs well on the 250 and 450, it has some big lines and is a relatively faster track even though it has a longer lap time than most SX tracks.
As you can see we have several longer rhythm sections, including a turning rhythm. Also the longer sand section through a whoop section. This track is ridable for all skill levels but is best for beginner and intermediate SX riders. Gate and pits for 22 riders.
Big shoutout to RedRider for all the track and pit objects. As well as all his tips that have helped me along the way.
Also a big shoutout to Lynds for his video series that got me into track building to begin with.
Yes the PKZ will not match the name of the track. I had already had everything built when the decision was made to change ”Location” to Annapolis.

items.title: Diablomx Ranch
items.creator: HydraRetro
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Welcome to DiabloMX Ranch.
(Formally Sandhill MX Ranch)
This is my first attempt at creating a replica track. It’s inspired by a local track in Brentwood, CA, USA. Known for decades as Sandhill MX Ranch, it was renamed Diablo MX Ranch a few years ago. The track is renowned for its large hill, a defining feature that has always been central to its layout. Although the layout has changed over the years, the main hill has remained a constant.
This was the first track I ever rode back in 2005. The replica layout I used reflects the track as it was before it sadly closed to the public in 2023. My goal was to recreate it to preserve its memory before moving on to my next major track build. I aimed to stay true to the original design, with the addition of making every jump and berm larger to suit the game. It rides best on a 125/250f, as a 450 would overjump everything but still provide a nice challenge.
I hope you enjoy it!
–
Special thanks to:
Resolute Kraken
Giopanda
RedRider197
Kellz & Cody
