items.title: Sinners Cove Featuring The 2024 Seattle Sx Beaver Trails Mx Woodbury Cty Mx
items.creator: Checkerz_448
items.description:
Description
Downloads
The Details:
OVER 50 – Designed and planned FREERIDE JUMPS
plus terrain specifically molded to create your own
Number of tracks: 3
Track types: Supercross (replica), National, Localcross, Freeride
’24 Sinners SEATTLE SX is inspired by a combination of the real event, the map, and video game fun.  The original reason for starting the project was to test my scaling and some ”rutted” SX replica sections.
’24 Sinners Woodbury Cty MX was previously a public motocross track funded by the County before being closed.  It’s now a practice track for the locals and features whooped out sand sections following the water’s edge before transitioning to loamy, jump filled dirt hillside sections.
’24 Sinners Beaverdale Trails MX started as a ”BMX dirt jump trails” track for Motocrossers, but the Checkerz Built crew decided to widen the course and host an event using their Supercross starting gate for the locals.  It’s a mix between a Freeride trail, Supercross track, practice track, and motocross course.  It may have a slight identity crisis, but it flows like a cool beverage after a day at the track.Tested and built on OEM Honda CRF450R primarily
The Story
(read in your best Karen news reporter voice):
The Ozarks are a popular family vacation destination… or at least most of it is!  Today’s story looks a little different. A bunch of annoying dirt bike drivers have taken over Woodbury County’s previously glorious valley called Sinner’s Cove on the outskirts of Beaverdale, MO. The county’s public riding park featured an MX track that was permanently closed and abandoned as locals claimed it was polluting their beaches.
That was before a design and excavation company called ”Checkerz Built” moved in and has let motorbikers roam the valley with no consequence. The lousy business owner most known for doing pop-wheelies while airborne on his offroad moped, added a professionally built Supercross track replica of Seattle’s 2024 race and some sort of ”BMX trails for motorbikers” called Beaverdale Trails MX on his property too.
Now that biker hooligans have over-run the valley, they have built ramps everywhere from the beach to the docks and even over the massive river.  Bikers are ripping down the road at all hours gaining speed to ramp off massive hills in death defying stunts.  We even saw one biker named Qwestshun JUMPING OVER THE HOUSE that the business owner constructed on the property.
The Cove has been over-run by these adrenaline fueled dare devils who are constantly doing burn-outs in the grass and beaches.  Many business owners have left to no longer deal with the biker rebels and only the sleeziest of businesses have been brain-washed by the biker gang to stay open.  They constantly are blaring music, revving their bikes and even party until the early hours of the morning sometimes. Outsiders no longer dare visit the off-road rebel controlled valley, once a glorious vacation paradise and romantic lookout in the Ozarks.
Until next week’s episode, this is Kry Baby Karen saying, ”These dirty sinners need to put down their bikes and pick up their bibles to go to church!”
The Credits:
Red/Kellz and Cody/Gio/Earthworks and anyone releasing additional assets for the community to use!
RK – Track Editor
TFC – Tutorial vids
Qwestshun – The sky cubes and making me add on and not finalize this track 5 times adding over 200 hours and a couple months to the release
KeLLz – Not calling me an idiot when I constantly broke things and had questions
The boys in KTW for the Beta session laughs

items.description:
Description

Hello! NewSkool here with a major announcement! Beginning May 29th One-One Designs and I are hosting a 10 round 250 SX series, which is a part of their full season 250 SMX championship! If you are interested in joining this series, please follow this link to their discord. https://discord.gg/5zvdU9xrbR
The tracks for this series will likely cater more to the beginner/intermediate supercross riders. There are a couple corners with alternate lines, the whoops are not too difficult but can cost you time.
Since this track was built for a 250 championship, that is what the vast majority of the testing was done with. I personally have run a 50.70 as my fastest lap at this point. However, one of the guys helping with testing was able to get into the low 49s.
I do love good positive criticism and tips. So if there is anything you think I should focus on doing better with, I’d love to hear it!
Just as with my first track, a massive shoutout to Lynds for his videos which helped me out big time start to understand what it takes to build tracks.
An equally as massive shout out to RedRider197. Not only for the stadium and track assets, but for his willingness to help and answer questions that helped me out big time!
also a big thanks to Phantomz for the skidsteer asset.

items.title: Cairo Gp
items.creator: punkerjeffy
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Cairo GP is a make believe track on the MXGP circuit. I’ve always been a huge Egypt fan and even spent last summer touring the country for 2 weeks with Dr. Robert Schoch. The track is a completely sand surface so it will take a little bit to get used to riding it. It has a close to realistic scaling and is rough the majority of the way around the track. It’s a challenging track to put together consistent laps(at least for me) but I think it will produce some good racing. I put a crazy amount of hours into this track so I hope you guys enjoy it.
Thanks go to:
Totes McGoats for learning together and testing
RedRider197 for the awesome tractors
GioPanda for the fences and track markers
Agitato for the banners
Resolute Kraken for the track builder tool
Rosshell*** for the MXGP assets
Disclaimer: There seems to be some controversy with the Rosshell assets available here on mxb-mods. I have no idea whether they are really ripped or not, but this will likely be my one and only tracking using these assets unless that’s cleared up.
UPDATE: I accidently included some large JPG and PSDs in my PKZs. Thank you Niko from mxbikes shop for pointing that out. I re-uploaded them without the images so both files should be 150mb smaller. There shouldn’t be any compatibility issues between the 2 versions.

items.title: Kelso Cup Rn 5 2024
items.creator: Patron
items.description:
Description
Downloads
HOWS IT GOING EVERYONE!!!
What you are about to ride is Round 5 of IBSKELSO’s Series called Kelso Cup. This week we have a very INTENSE, FUN, SIMI DIFFICULT, HIGH SPEED and the first ever FREE split gate drop start supercross track that i know of built by the one and only Patron. All jumps are custom made meaning i used no template to add a fully new riding experience and style to have a great time and or race with your friends. The inspiration for this track was the 2012 Monster Cup, I used mostly the same layout but added my own personal twist to make it unique and more of a great time to ride.
To my knowledge The remainder of the Kelso Cup Rounds are most likely going to be held on mymxb, So make sure you guys sign up for future races if not already.
SORRY FOR THE TIMING GATE ISSUES IN THE FIRST POST
HOPE YOU ALL ENJOY AND ANY FEEDBACK BAD OR GOOD IS ALWAYS WELCOME!!!!!!

items.title: Metcalf Mx Park
items.creator: RTL Media
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Nestled amidst the vibrant landscape of San Jose, California, Metcalf MX Park stands as a thrilling haven for motocross enthusiasts of all levels. Metcalf’s motocross track can accommodate all skill levels and is great for riders still learning while remaining fun for those who are looking to get into a rhythm and put in some quick lap times!
This built track is a replica of the 2016 layout before the park combined the moto and GP courses. I reconstructed the old layout in memory of my youth, growing up on a dirt bike, and getting comfortable on a MX track. The track may not be overly glamorous, but I’ve always appreciated the wonderful memories I have on this track and I’m excited to share it with the MXB community!
Track Details:
Skill Level: Beginner-Advance
Length: 0.8 Miles
Pit/Gates: 24
YouTube Ride Through Preview:

items.title: Nuggetboi Bielsteiner Waldkurs
items.creator: NuggetBoi
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Hey! I’m NuggetBoi and I proudly present you my second track 🙂 I’m sorry that it took a little longer but i focused on improving my skills and listened to your feedback on my last track.
I still can’t believe that Bielstein wasn’t already in the game. Bielstein is a track with a lot of history. Back in the days (since 1959) GPs took place here. In 1981 the MXoN was held on this beatiful track in western Germany. Nowadays this track is a highlight in the ADAC Masters series.
This track has 40 gates. I moved the finishline to make this more elemination race friendly (This time it’s already on the server list. Sorry Aiden).
If you are having perfomance issues, turn off 3D Grass. I don’t understand why, but the 3D Grass was creating lags from the beginning of the track making. If anyone know how to fix this, let me know 🙂
I tested the track on all OEM Bikes. The uphill Step-Up is not easy for 250ccm but is doable (go outside at the bottom of the hill).

items.title: Hydra Hill
items.creator: HydraRetro
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Welcome to Hydra Hill.
This is my first track, and it is a fictional track set on my IRL property. I used real world height map data to get the scale and actually went outside and touched grass to help me model the landscape. My goal was to see what a track could look like if I used all my property to build one. Because I only have a humble 5 acres, the track is short and compact but also beginner-friendly since I am new to the game and have put more time into this track than the actual game itself.
I previously modeled my house and garage to scale, so I used them as a part of the track. You will find yourself racing through the breezeway and in-between the house and garage. The only collisions on the track are the house and garage.
There is the main MX track, and outside the main area, there is the example SX track, a bermed Flat Track, an FMX area, and a Trail that loops (watch out for the crashed UFO).
–
NOTE: This track was designed for and tested on a 125/250f.
–

items.title: Spun Valley Mx
items.creator: WESTERFIELD147
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Hey Friends!
You guys might or might not have been wondering why you haven’t really seen any bike/gear mods from me lately.
Thats because I have been working on this.
Anyway, this is a fantasy track straight from my brain. I’m still new to track building so
helpful/constructive/kind feedback is much appreciated. It means more than you think
and makes everything worth it so dont be shy!
Features:
1. Motocross track with some SX/SMX influenced sections
2. Big floaters
3. Peaked doubles
4. Split choice sections (desgigned so that split sections are timed evenly for fair racing)
5. A long lake that winds throughout the track
6. The right amount of roughness so its challenging but not punishing
7. Good elevation change
8. Made to accomodate all skill levels
9. Wide variety of obstacles
10. 40 pits
11. 30 gates
Recommendations:
1. If you mess up in a section dont try to keep jumping through the rest of it. Instead just go around an obstacle or 2
so you can get your momentum back up. Yeah you’ll get a timing cut or 2 to make it fair for everyone else but you’ll be flowing again.
2. If you’re able to take corners and maintain good momentum most of the time you’ll want to ride
one of the OEM 250F’s.
3.If you aren’t the best at keeping momentum or you crash often then hop on something faster like an E10 Factory 250f or OEM 350/450.
4. Use your brain and be on time or you’re going to wad yourself up.
5. Don’t trip if you fall in the water. It’s not the easiest to get back onto dry land but definitely
do-able if you do fall in.
6. When in doubt, send it.
Credits:
Resolute Kracken – Track Building Tool
Red Rider – Testing, Water/Dump Trucks, and Water Help
ConsumingClouds – Testing/Feedback
Ryan Cardo – Garages
Cody & Kellz – Y Tree Pack
Matrica – Mask/Chromlum Help
KingMX818 – Heightmap Info
Thanks:
Red Rider – You’re awesome and super humble. I cannot thank you enough.
ConsumingClouds – You are a great friend dont ever change!
Matrica – Thanks dude, I appreciate you.
KingMX818 – Thanks for the tips.
Enjoy guys!

items.title: Stonepoint Rd1 Bmgfx
items.creator: Buzz Cooksey
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Instructions
My second track release is here! Had the idea to replicate an MX vs. ATV Reflex track because this game is what brought me to MX Bikes. I played it for years since it came out and I’ve gotta thank people like Tylyn, Something Rad and Skootypuff Jr for getting me into MX Bikes! This took about a month to make and I wanted to do it right, especially for my second go at track making. It was an interesting process getting the scaling right so that it translates with the physics engine of MX Bikes. You can run a 250 and 450 on here. Multiple available lines like in Reflex. I’m able to clear 90% of the big lines on the 250 myself!
CREDITS:
RedRider – Endless amount of help, stadium, gate, finish, bales, and semis assets. An actual GOAT.
Steezy – Texturing help. Seriously the man for showing me how its done.
Agitato – Holeshot arch.
Janes46 – Night skydome.
Kellz & Cody – Trees.
TheFluffyGecko – FMX ramps and landing.
DirtTwister – Track map from Reflex. Made doing this quite a bit easier!
For video of a lap around the track,
CLICK HERE
or click the thumbnail!
I did really enjoy making this and I wanna put even more tracks out in the future! I hope you guys like what I put together here! 🙂
Subscribe to my YouTube channel
HERE
if you hadn’t already! Gonna start streaming REAL SOON so Sub now to stay updated!
If you’d like me to add your name, number, etc. to anything I make, or anything done completely from scratch, HMU on Discord: actuallybuzz#3552

items.title: State Flow
items.creator: subtsub
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Welcome to State Flow MX, my first ever track creation – very happy to get any feedback you have on it for the next one as it’s been a learning experience the whole way through (I’m a YouTuber, I can handle feedback!)
Track’s built for 450s, but it is still rideable on a 125, you might just need to stretch a few things out…
Speaking of stretching out, there are a couple of big 450 lines for you to explore too, the goal was for some sections to be quite risk/reward based.
I hope you enjoy riding it as much as I enjoyed making it!
Note: it lacks elevation, didn’t want to stretch too far for my first track, but hopefully it’s enjoyable anyway… Also erode is quite strong, just how I like it, so if that’s not your preference, turn it down!
HUGE shout out to these people:
Red Rider – for most of the assets used
Kellz & Cody – for the trees and bushes
Giopanda – for the stakes and a couple of other little assets

items.title: Sakura Beach Mx
items.creator: ConsumingClouds
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Sakura Beach Mx is an island paradise with a lot to offer for your spring break plans.
MX Track – Sand traction on top but its a fairly thin layer and below that is soft soil traction so the deformation ruts will be grippy. The in-game erode ruts form well in testing so it will be good for high erode activities
Freeride Dunes – Surrounding the track are dunes for endless jump combos
Tubular waves – I have made improvements in my wave making technology since Daytona and now have the ability to make the waves have tubes and spray
Paved trail – Wheelie enthusiasts will enjoy the paved trail.
World Famous Island Home – I modeled the Kame House from the Dragon Ball universe (look closely into the front window) and if anyone wants to use it on their track here is a link to download the blender model, fbx file, and textures – https://mega.nz/file/E6F1mKJT#_aHfRWx3-trD9vQZSxwazgF6WBKgkfoUUoXBStMN9DQ

The track is renowned for its thrilling combination of high-speed straights and challenging corners, providing riders with the perfect mix of adrenaline-pumping action and technical skill.
As riders accelerate down the fast sections, the roar of their engines fills the air, creating an electrifying atmosphere that resonates throughout the circuit. The smooth dirt section adds an extra layer of excitement, testing the riders’ control and precision as they navigate the varying terrain.
Competitors and spectators alike are captivated by the skill and bravery on display as riders push themselves to the limit in pursuit of victory. The MusselMan Honda Circuit truly embodies the spirit of MX Bikes racing, offering an unforgettable experience for all who dare to take on its twists and turns.

items.title: Blacksmith By Totes Mickgoats
items.creator: totes_mickgoats
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Welcome to “Blacksmith,” my custom MX Bikes track inspired by the 2017 Ironman MX layout and named to honor Indiana’s deep blacksmithing roots. I dedicated close to 200 hours to create this track, ensuring every detail was perfect. From meticulously timing the corners to scaling the jumps, I studied race replays to make sure the track rode as close to real life as possible. Whether you’re gearing up for a competition or just seeking a fresh challenge, Blacksmith offers a thrilling and authentic motocross experience that will put your skills to the test. It’s wide, with big jumps, and rough corners! Hope you enjoy it and go fast! ✌️😎
BIG thanks to these people as well:
– Red Rider for the assets like banners and trucks
– HellRoss for the assets like banners and arches and other materials
– Agitato for all of the assets that he’s provided
– GioPanda for all of the assets that he’s provided
– Punkerjeffy for helping with testing and always sharing ideas and listening to me blab about track building nonstop.
Logo was themed after the infamous “Godzilla” Jump.

Description
Downloads
Hey everyone! it’s been a minute, but I’m back with another track for you! This time I figured I’d give SX a shot. This is my first attempt at a supercross track, so please give whatever feedback you can, so I can make the appropriate changes for the next one.
This is the 2024 layout of Philadelphia. The scaling isn’t supposed to prep you for ARL, as I built the track to ride how I want it to, and to cater to a wider demographic. There’s a freshly graded version, which you’ll find in-game called “Media Day”. It’s been made to be easier, with the whoops being the most challenging part of that version. There are some big lines possible, and some technical aspects that can catch you out if you’re not careful. There’s a second version with prebuilt ruts and roughness called “Night Show” to hopefully give everyone a version they will enjoy. Careful though, in this version the track has been thoroughly abused, and the plywood’s starting to show through the bottom of some of the ruts, which are quite deep in some spots, leaving some lines not worth trying unless you need to. This version isn’t supposed to be easy, it’s supposed to push you to be more accurate and reserved to make your way around without dragging bars, or cross rutting.
I can’t overstate this enough, without RedRider this release would be nothing. Every model you see on this map was made by him. the bales, start gate, finish arch, all the pit objects, and of course this amazing stadium. Which, now that I’m done the track, he will generously be releasing the stadium on mxbmods for EVERYONE to use on their own tracks in the next few days.
Also thanks to Earthwurx, stoney for the sauce, HSM for testing.
I hope you enjoy.
Thanks to Falcon for the preview lap on Media Day, and Mooham for the preview on the night show.

items.title: Procworks Snocross Rd 2
items.creator: DevoPROCworks
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Welcome to RD.2 Of The PROCworks Snocross Series!
Featuring a more supercross style similar to many Amsoil Snocross Tracks. With the feel of Sleds in stadiums again, like the good old days of racing in the Super Snocross series, WSA or few Amsoil Snocross Series Stadium events! Consisting of 2 rhythm roller sections, triples, step on/off and multiple fast lines to see whats quickest through the pack! I left this track more smooth “groomed Feel” than RD.1, ruts up and breaks down very nice over a few laps. 16 Gates, indoor pit area and Freestyle Ramps for the halftime show. This is a fast paced track, if you dont hit the rollers right your gonna lose alot of time!
Don’t Forget To Give The Crowd A Show After The Race!
Thank you again of coarse to everybody supporting the Snocross Content and The Earthwurx guys for putting up with this Snow and all the help along the way!

items.title: 2024 Kelso Cup Rd 4
items.creator: bakedMinotaurs
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Whats up everyone!
Here is round 4 of the Kelso Cup series! Unfortunately didn’t have enough sign ups to run the race, but that doesnt mean the track will stand stagnant.
A lot of time went into this one, trying to get the scaling dialed and allowing multiple line options in each rhythm section. Track was scaled for 250s, as the series is held to the 250 class only. There are a few quad lines for the 250, so that means the 450s will most likely have some 5s & 6s in some of the rhythms. Track is super technical, but not over the top. That doesn’t hinder the fun aspect of this track, because once u get the lines figured out this track is an absolute blast to spin lap after lap.
Hope you all enjoy! If you are interested in signing up for future Kelso Cup rounds, you can find everything you need to know at www.kelsocup.com
TRACK HAS BEEN UPLOADED TO THE DEDI LIST, PLEASE BE PATIENT BUT SHOULD SEE IT LOADED SOON

items.title: Mjsx2 Winter Edition
items.creator: insane
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Welcome to
Jaeckels Hillside SX 2019
, or in short:
MJSX2 Winter Edition
. –
TL;DR
This track was originally made by MJrace for MX Simulator. Back in 2019 I messaged him on Instagram and he allowed me to port this track into MX Bikes. Actually, I even released this track in late 2019 around christmas time as a total bugfest because I’ve been rushing the release and the winter theme was a pretty spontaneous idea.
Even that the heightmap was pretty much done and I was happy with how it felt in MX Bikes, I never touched the track again.
Until now.
I loved the idea of a winter themed track as we never had anything similiar (besides the Winter Wonderland freeride track), so I dug the old project files up and started using
Resolute Krakens Track Helper
which was a blessing. Working on a track never felt as great as with this handy tool. Definitely check it out!
Back to topic
: I started adapting my old project files to RKTH and realized how much fun it actually does. So I kept going and now we’re here. Pictures say more than words so take a look:
Credits:
Massive thanks to
Resolute Kraken
for his help and his track helper app. This tool really kept me going!
Thanks to
Ruubs
(Ruben Kuilder) for the awesome looking bales!
Thanks to
Niko Mouk
for his object placement tutorials!
Last but not least: thanks to MJRace for the permission to do this!
I hope you all like it, if anything feels weird or you have weird performance issues, I’m happy to take a look at it!
Don’t eat the yellow snow.

items.title: Steezy93 High Altitude Mx
items.creator: Steezy93
items.description:
Description
Downloads
https://youtu.be/Ru9Bfxlx2w8?si=5LK0DRP4R4hTIR8w
Today I present to you my first track release. It features 1 mx track and 30 freeride jumps that are intertwined around the track. There are 2 different coloured skies – the blue version for clear and the purple sunset version for cloudy. It is a fantasy track with some interesting features set in the deep woodland of the Lake District National Park, UK. Not the widest for racing I am aware but it definitely is a whole vibe! I started building it for factory 250s, though rideable; current 250s are a tiny bit too slow I would recommend OEM 450s or 350s instead. There will be more to come from me I already have 3 other tracks in the works.
Disclaimer I am not SteezyMX.
Credits – Slutwalrus and the WFO Racing guys that have done most of the testing. Eltrex aka VM Visuals for helping me with blender. Everyone that helped me in the mod-track section of the mx bikes community discord server: especially Bishop for telling me that its a “cool concept poorly executed” on an early work in progress. Endo for the masking tutorial for noobs video.
Objects credits – Redrider197, Rosshell, Kellz & Cody,
See screenshots Below, and check out the promo video on my YouTube

items.title: Patrons Test Track
items.creator: Patron
items.description:
Description
Downloads
HOWDY DUE EVERYONE!
This is my FIRST EVER track release and i wanted it to be a little special and different. What i was able to come up with was a sx test track
that was inspired by “2010 ST. Louis Round 14” but with my own personal twist of a long split section that i don’t see sx really have no more.
I focused on making this Test Track super realistic with making sure lines weren’t unrealistic and being able to send a quad that just doesn’t feel like should be possible, Making sure all lines were able to be hit both on 250 and 450, Making it so your sometimes forced to hit a double because you didn’t have momentum and or scrub properly, Having sharper jumps so it kind of feels like your floating and or jumping decently high so if you were to case in a certain way you would be discipline and most likely crash and go over the bars not just be able to eat the jump and still end up flowing through a section perfectly fine. I would say its a intermediate track it can flow pretty easy but if your really trying to be fast and consistent you have to be pretty good cause it does take scrubbing pretty well to clear on 450 and even more 250. I wanted to do something slightly different then other sx and add kind of a foresty feel to it.
I truly enjoy this track and so exited to share it with everyone and see the times that can be put down. There is a fun little multiple trails on the outside of the whole tracks that have splits, I wish i put a little more time with the outside trail but i was super anxious to put it out so i didn’t focus to much on that, it isent perfect but i would love all the feedback good and bad to be able to improve in the future have a nice rest of the day
Shoutout To People That HELPED with questions and SUPPORT me
Helped with questions:
Bakeminotaurs
Zalador
Reviewing the Track/Content:
IBSKELSO
SYNN
AIDEN
SMOKSTAS
and everyone that does after uploaded

items.description:
Description
Downloads
THESE ARE NOT NEW TRACKS!!! THESE ARE A REUPLOAD!!!
DEVIL’S GULCH FILE HAS BEEN UPDATED, THANK YOU TO THE PPL WHO REACHED OUT <3
Hello all, hope you are well. When I left the game/community 3 months ago, I decided that I no longer wanted my tracks to be in the ever growing toxicity that is MX Bikes. After a few months away, I have decided to upload them as a repository, to be one stop place for all my previous tracks that I had permanently deleted. I have started building again but unsure if I will release another anytime soon. (I say that now, and then ill probably end up making a bunch more lol)
17 Tracks In Total, some of them were made yrs ago, before I even mildly understood optimization (still playable obviously). But none the less, they are free tracks.
Much love to you all.
CREDITS:
Kellz – for help/various objects throughout the years

items.title: Atr Racing Amateur Sx Compound
items.creator: OhTea
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Well… here we go! This is my first track release.
I’ve made a few attempts at building a track, following TFC’s tutorials, but I was never happy with anything I created.
Lynd’s recently released series of tutorials re-sparked my creative juices and I thought I would give it another pop.
The track is geared towards beginner / intermediate level riders with a couple hundred hours in game.
I tried to create a track with a similar style to the Mini O’s SX track at Gatorback; fast, flowy, fast paced racing, room for error.
Overall I am pleased with the finished product, it took me way longer than it should’ve because I am way too OCD.
Let me know what you think below, or drop me a line on Discord! ohtea_
I can’t thank the below creators enough for their help:
Red Rider – endless supply of amazing objects (bales, semi’s, watertruck etc)
TFC – for the tutorials and teaching me the basics of L3DT
Lynds – for the recent tutorial series and making the whole process very idiot proof
The ATR Racing crew for beta testing the track and providing feedback

items.title: Sx Test Site
items.creator: bakedMinotaurs
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Instructions
What’s up everyone!
What we have here is a little supercross training compound, packed with 2 supercross track, as well as a fun little free ride area. The 2 SX layouts are based off of 2024 St Louis & 2024 Denver. They’re not fully 100% replicas, but only differ slightly from the irl track maps.
The clay (orange) track is St Louis, and the grey dirt track is Denver, or my interpretation of it based on the track maps. Both are somewhat difficult but once u get the lines down shouldn’t be too bad for newcomers to supercross. The whoop sections on both tracks are pretty tough, especially if you thought the whoops on Kelso Cup round 1 were hard. But once you can start hitting them consistent i feel it will more than prepare you for the ARL races. You won’t find these tracks super rough, but I did add some breaking bumps and chop to the courses to add some level of difficulty/immersion.
Tracks work well for both 250s & 450s, most lines are doable on the smaller CC’s but will find u have to stretch some sections slightly. The 450 is an absolute blast to rip, both layouts have a few quad line options.
You’ll definitely want to bring the 450 out to the free ride area, as there are a couple massive booters that send you to the moon. I didn’t spend a whole lot of time on this area as the main focus was on the supercross tracks, but if you get bored rippin motos then this is perfect for wanting to chill and hit some fun transfers.
For some reason (mainly because I have about 3 brain cells) I wasn’t able to get each track on their own layout, and put everything in one pkz. So, I’ll have a pkz for each layout to download, and if u want both layouts I will have both pkz’s in one zipped folder. Files sizes are somewhat large, which is the reason i’m posting each pkz separately. If size is no problem, simply download the zipped folder, unzip and drag both pkz’s into your mods/tracks folder
Hope you enjoy! It’s not perfect, but it’s fun nonetheless. Each track has 40 pits, and 22 gates so hopefully will see some fun lobbies on both layouts.
Server versions are going to be added, I am unfortunately having issues signing into the track manager 🙁
HUGE THANKS TO EVERYONE THAT HELPS AND SUPPORTS ME!!
EarthWurx –
knowledge and help, and putting up with my millions of questions
Red Rider –
same as above, still holding strong with a 5 star customer service rating. Also the water trucks, water, EarthWurx machines, dunlop archway, and blender help

the sauce

template help, and constructive criticisms (yes my 3ft singles are still fat)
Resolute Kraken –
rk helper & tutorials

tracked help & tutorials

tracked help & tutorials
Kellz –
help with various things, & tree objects
Ryan Cardno –
Warehouse
Dylan Frisch –
Fence
Disturbed Kid –
white round bales asset pack
All the youtube guys –
Lynda, Kelso, Smoksta, Scizy, basically everyone that reviews my tracks you all are one of the reasons i love doing this

items.title: Procworks Snocross Rd 1
items.creator: DevoPROCworks
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Welcome to My First Proper Snocross Track. The PROCworks RD.1
A fun realistic Snocross track, 16 working gates, pits by Semi’s, a few split lane corners and some fun racing set in a Southern Canadian Ski Hill National series. Track is sand based for loose snow feel with soft soil underneath. Slight pre made roughness. Deform setting at 0.19 is what ive run but could do more (if you like it rough “haha”), alot of good fun to race in the rain and turn the roost up!
Tested with REV-DOO 600 and the unreleased 600RR (Available Soon)
Thank You to the many supporters of this Snocross Project So Far! To the creators of these assets, and the guys at EarthWurx for the help or added knowledge for my first National Track!

items.title: Monaco F1 Supermoto
items.creator: ConsumingClouds
items.description:
Description
Downloads
The streets of Monaco have hosted Grand Prix racing for almost 100 years. I don’t believe there has ever been a motorcycle race around here, but I feel like the layout really lends itself to a good supermoto track.
I scaled the width/length to suit the supermoto gear range but left the vertical scaling to be as close to real life as possible using google earth elevations. I used the old chicane for better racing.
The buildings have been replaced with a rocky cliff area with trees with heavy inspiration from The Cliffs of Dover but more of a marble surface to represent the incredible wealth of the real life Monaco.
Big thank you to the following:
Resolute Kraken – track builder program
Red Rider –  Water and overall advice

Insane and the rest of the site team for all that you do to organize all the mods in one place. Thank you for getting the site back up so quickly.

items.title: Riverside Mx Re Imagined
items.creator: Lynds
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Well, it’s finally here! I could honestly spend weeks and weeks tweaking things but for the sake of a first track release I’m happy to release it as it is. I have learnt so much in the 90 hours I’ve spent on this bad boy, multiple programs I’ve never touched before, hours and hours of YouTube tutorials and lots of questions in the Earthwurx discord.
Here is Riverside MX Re-Imagined! What started as a replica track of a track in the South East of the UK which has been closed for many many years soon turned into a semi-replica once I realised how boring an exact copy would be. So instead, I’ve added loads of extra jumps and ruts that were never there IRL and it really makes it so much better in game.
The masking of 3d grass and the transition between off-track and on-track textures could definitely be improved however that’s where my photoshop skills were definitely a limiting factor! The shadows make some ruts intentionally difficult to see just to spice things up a bit and for all of you WFO warriors, I’m afraid there’s a few corners you’re gonna have to slow down for!
All jumps can be cleared on a 250, I’m sure they’re also possible on a 125 if you hit the outsides hard enough!
https://youtu.be/bRe8viNkxcE
(Video will be live 10 minutes after this post)
A massive thankyou to the following:

items.title: Uk Arenacross Rd 5 Wembley By Lynds
items.creator: Lynds
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Heres another track for your gaming pleasures!
Round 5 of the UK Arenacross series at Wembley, London. Myself and Charlie were invited to watch this race in person by the AJP Racing boys and it was a great time so wanted to recreate it in game.
Track is based on end of main event so has broken down whoops and a few ruts in corners. Bales are blown out on purpose and the video used for reference is below:
Cedric Soubeyras Wembley Gopro
Bales do not have collisions however cuts are strict so no going through them or outside of them to scumbag big lines.
Laptimes are the same as IRL pro times.
Ruts need to be slowed down for, don’t complain if its tight, its AX, I promise it was tighter IRL.
Have fun, enjoy it, let me know if you want the other 4 rounds and shout if there’s any errors when testing!

items.title: The Compound Lot Snocross
items.creator: DevoPROCworks
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Its getting near the end of the season and warm out, its starting to melt but we pushed all the snow we could to keep the place together for one last ride before the township may even shut us down. We called a couple race teams out for a last practice, while the ramp guys stole one of the Skidsteers and got the ramp hits all in check.
Welcome to “The Compound Lot.” My first track release for the Snocross Pack
.
Based on an edge of town setting, this freeride/snocross practice park built on a dead end road just on the edge of town. I’d made this place while learning height maps and track building.
Using the example track files as my base, id attempted to remake the example track heightmap in photoshop with many changes to scale and jump faces. All focused on finding the balance of fun and realism of a snocross track.
We grew up riding ramps, and i had this old file lying around of a Freestyle Snowmobile Ramp id made a long time ago. Which quite luckily rides really well in MXB with no changes. Theres 3, a Super Kicker, Comp Ramp and a long Distance out in the back of the yard.
Before I experimented with making Freestyle ramps in my height map instead of objects. Which worked. But this Snow hit here, will kick the front end high and make flips much easier for upside down tricks. Wasn’t my intention but it worked so well i said the hell with it and left it in the middle of “The Ramp Six Pack”.
Theres alot of fun Hits at The Compound Lot. 2 Six Packs, one focusing on Snow Jumps while other focused on Ramps (With the Flip Snow Hit). A bigger gap loop around the property. Please be respectful of the old cabin out back and clean up after yourselves.
I learned alot on this, and many changes still could have been made but really wanted to get something out for guys to ride some sleds on. No reason you cant rip a bike around here either though, Snocross track is Sand based and jump sections are Soft soil based.
I have another track that im working on that is only Snocross/National style focused for racing, so i decided to stop tweaking this to get it done, and for everybody to enjoy this on. Its my first track, its not perfect, the track is very simple but the map gives a good vibe and alot of fun. I hope everybody enjoys my FIRST track release.
All objects are free and licensed for use. But id like to thank these guys on MXB for already having some assets made to the public for use, so i didnt have to build and convert files in blender as much lol.
Currently only works in testing until the server file is uploaded. Sorry for any inconvenience!
Redrider197 – Semi Pack
Agitato – Fly Finish Archways
PHANTOMZ – Skidsteer
Cody James/Kellz – Tree Pack

items.title: Grass Track Mx Compound Sx And Ax Tracks
items.creator: Checkerz_448
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Checkerz448 and AirWheeliesOnly are back with a fresh training facility for MX Bikes featuring Supercross and Arenacross practice tracks. Both are raceable, both are free, and both are likely about as impressive as a washed up pro doing a boner air… and trust me, I’m expert at that.
Grab your pizza rolls, a fresh 4-pack of your favorite energy drink, and plant your crumb-covered buns in-front of the screen; these tracks are about as hot as yesterday’s pizza and half as tasty! Hit that download button before mom tells you it’s bedtime and kills the basement power.
Enjoy my second release for MXB.  I’ll tell you up front, it’s like the cute mom next door fresh outta the mini-van.  Gorgeous and if she had a fashion designer and make-up artist she’d be a super model, but the bare bones are gorgeous.  AKA… it doesn’t have all the fancy dress-up stuff, but it’s a natural beauty to flow around.
Thanks again to the Earth Wurx squad for their continued help.  RR and Gio for the objects, RK for the editor, and all the legends for their YouTube tutorials.  I apologize if I forgot someone, I think that’s it.

items.title: 2024 Kelso Cup Rd 3
items.creator: bakedMinotaurs
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Instructions
What’s up Everyone!
Round 3 of Kelso Cup is probably my favorite so far. You may notice a familiar layout, the legendary 2014 Toronto SX, where James Stewart basically came from dead last to win the race. Whoop section is much easier than the previous rounds, but still pretty challenging.
The track is scaled more for the 250s, there are a few quad lines if your fast and on the 450 in the long rhythm theres a quad quad quad line thats pretty nuts. Have fun! Hope to see you at Round 4! Details can be found in Kelso’s discord and on www.kelsocup.com.

items.title: Snake Way
items.creator: Lizard
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Rest in Peace Akira Toriyama – creator of Dragon Ball and many other timeless stories.
This is the closest I could get to recreating the iconic Snake Way that connects the afterlife to the living universe. There are no timing gates, the “map” is meant to be the Capsule Corp. logo, and the layout is meant to resemble a 1 star dragon ball. There are no jumps, I wanted to make it possible to load this up and ride while you watch your favorite Toriyama anime, or anything really.
I hope you all enjoy.

Canyon Rush
It’s finally here! I had this crazy idea for a track and for the past 11 months ive been trying to turn it into a reality. After many variations of the track layout i landed on something im happy with, i tried to make it very flowy with a few technical parts mixed in between some big booters, its a perfect track for a 2stroke or 250 in my opinion. it features 40 pitboxes and gates with a length of 3189 meters of rollercoaster fun. items.title: Valley View Ranch
items.creator: punkerjeffy
items.description:
Description
Downloads
This is my first track for MX Bikes. I used to create tracks for MCM2 and Reflex and finally picked this game up to start building tracks for it. The tracking creating process is head and shoulders above any of the previous games thanks to tools like Resolute’s track builder and all the PiBoSo tools included in it as well as iNsane’s .pkz locker. There’s also such a good library of videos put out by the community to help. Huge shout out to all those guys. Also a big thanks to Ruubs(or maybe Sandbiter) for the trees, GioPanda for the Tents and porta pottys, RedRider for the semis, and PDR for a tuffblock base that I was able to texture. Thanks to my buddy Totes MickGOATs for learning the track creation process with me and exchanging tips and beta testing.
This is a realistic style national track with a lot of rutted corners for different line choices. It’s mostly rough with a few booters but nothing too big. There’s also an FMX area to play around on and a trail that goes around the edge of the map.  I’m still new to the game so it’s pretty much impossible for me to get a clean lap so I’ll be interested what people can do on it. My fastest is 2:00 with no crashes. I found anywhere from 1.0-2.0 deformation works pretty well but over that it gets a little too rough to fall into the ruts. One last thing is I wasn’t sure which beta version to choose when uploading the track and didn’t find anything in steam or the game that told me which version I’m on so I just picked the newest version.
I hope you guys enjoy it!

items.title: 2024 Kelso Cup Rd 2
items.creator: bakedMinotaurs
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Instructions
What’s up everyone!
What we have here is round 2 of IBSKelso’s series, called the Kelso Cup. This weeks track brought the intensity with a technical, “make or break” rhythm section. This round was built by yours truly, didn’t get the jump template fully dialed in but i think it adds to the difficulty ever so slightly. Round 2 was last week, the plan is to release each track an hour before the race starts on kelsocup.com for free. After the event is over, the track will be released here.
Any rumors going around of this series “trying to take over the ARL series” is absurd and childish. It’s a completely new format of racing and just gives players another avenue to race. This is in no way, shape, or form, to discredit or take anything from mxbmods, mxbshop, or mymxb. There’s enough division in the game, some think there has to be a “meta” with everything and that takes away enjoyment from the whole game.
Have fun! Details for Round 3 can be found in Kelso’s discord, as well as www.kelsocup.com
None of this would have been possible without the following;
Earthwurx – answering any questions i have, and showing me ze way
Red Rider – All the supercross objects, and help with my annoying questions <3 5 star customer service rating
StoneRider – For the sauce
Jackie Moon – Catch Nets
Jesse Mulock – help with tracked stuffs
Logan aka Mr Earthwurx – helping me out with the jump template
ITZP4NDA – help with build
IBSKelso – hosting the series, and giving me positive encouragement
Stratos – same as above, and the main guy behind building the website and setting up the races
Resolute Kraken – track builder helper & tutorials
Thank you to everyone that helped test this as well! If I missed anyone, please feel free to let me know!
ALSO, the file size is a tad large, but that's due to the baseball stadium i used. everything is as optimized as it can be, so shouldnt really have issues with lag or frame drops

items.title: Checkerz Sky Ranch Compound
items.creator: Checkerz_448
items.description:
Description
Downloads
RK editor (Whew, what a great tool!) name was GreenValley so pkz and download carry that name.  It is ‘24 Checkerz Sky Ranch – (name of which of 4 tracks) in game.  It’ll be towards the top.
Welcome to the Checkerz Sky Ranch, my first ever MXB track. Figured it was fitting that my last MXS track would be my first for MXB.  SX tracks and AX plus freeride are 100% new.  National is 65% brand new too.
Track features 4 raceable tracks and some pretty cool designed freeride sections.  The national, two SX tracks, and an Arenacross.
It was designed by a begooner on a 450 OEM bike.  Pros will likely find it easy.  It’s pretty smooth, features some whip/scrub chances and a variety of terrain and elevation.
Checkerz Sky Ranch is a new compound for MX Bikes brought to you by Air Wheelies Only.  Known for producing the slowest riders at the races, The Ranch is “Where the slow go to get slower!”  It’s all fun and games, they leave that working hard crap to the million other facilities out there.  Daily trips to the moon available soon!  If not going fast and definitely getting last is your thing do not miss out on this terribly amazing  or amazingly terrible track release.
Thank you for helping make Checkz Sky Ranch possible.
TF for tutorials, RK too.  And any videos released showing how to make tracks. You guys are legends.
Earthwurx Community – Known for their talent and art, but most powerful because the network of knowledge.  The only reason I was able to complete this project.
baked Minotaurs/Red Rider/Giopanda/Ryan Cardno – Objects
Bclay/Para/Mulock – Endless guidance/fixes/encouragement
Thank you to Lynds for the video and hype and Mulock for screens.

items.title: 2024 Kelso Cup Rd 1
items.creator: bakedMinotaurs
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Instructions
What’s up everyone!
What we have here is round 1 of IBSKelso’s series, called the Kelso Cup. This track raced really well, has some fun sections, and is great for casual riding. Round 1 was last week, the plan is to release each track an hour before the race starts on kelsocup.com for free. After the event is over, the track will be released here.
Any rumors going around of this series “trying to take over the ARL series” is absurd and childish. It’s a completely new format of racing and just gives players another avenue to race. This is in no way, shape, or form, to discredit or take anything from mxbmods, mxbshop, or mymxb. There’s enough division in the game, some think there has to be a “meta” with everything and that takes away enjoyment from the whole game.
The start gate does have slight collisions, I left them be because i felt it added another layer of difficulty and seemed to work out ok.
Have fun! Details for Round 2 can be found in Kelso’s discord, as well as www.kelsocup.com
None of this would have been possible without the following;
Earthwurx – answering any questions i have, and showing me ze way
Red Rider – All the supercross objects, and help with my annoying questions <3
StoneRider – For the sauce
Jackie Moon – Catch Nets
Jesse Mulock – help with tracked stuffs
Logan aka Mr Earthwurx – helping me out with the jump template
ITZP4NDA – built rough heightmap
IBSKelso – hosting the series, and giving me positive encouragement
Stratos – same as above, and the main guy behind building the website and setting up the races
Thank you to everyone that helped test this as well! If I missed anyone, please feel free to let me know!

DAYTONAAAAAA, DO IT FOR DALEEEEEEE!!!!
Excited for you guys to try this out. So many lines to choose from its not even funny. Whether you jump, or decide to skim through the whoops, there are about 4 different ways to get through them. This project has taken me over 140 hours including building and testing and I have faced many challenges along the way . items.title: Bartow Motocross
items.creator: nolan3838
items.description:
Description
Downloads
**Track updated** Went through the whole track and added improved roughness. Eroded jump faces and more pronounced braking/accelerating bumps have been added. With jump face erode, body position on the bike is crucial due to a kickers on the faces. Texture masks have also been tweaked a bit and overall definitely an improved and fun track to ride. Some of the smaller bikes should have an easier time clearing the big jumps as well with the new jump faces and well.. the new OEMs.
This is a replica track of my hometown track that has recently closed down in Bartow Florida. This is the first time I have created a track and I felt that it would be a pretty straightforward and fun track to build.
The track is built in an old phosphate mining area so in real life it is dry, sandy and gypsum stacks line the horizon. with that said, I still decided with going the soft soil route. With this, the track features some acceleration bumps in certain corners and a touch of general roughness which really starts to show once the track gets eroded. A 250 can clear every jump on the track but in some turns a 450 (like real life) will certainly have an advantage. Overall the track is fast and momentum will give you the advantage. Track is a 1 to 1 scale so it is a little narrow but works well.
The track layout is a mixture of the 2009 layout mixed with a little bit of 2010 layout. From the finish line through the big 120+ footer in the back and through to the rhythm section, its 2009. From there to the finish it is modeled after 2010 when they decided to incorporate a tighter “supercross inspired” setup. For the start area, it is different then real life and is going to cause havoc in online lobbies (use your brakes), but if you get through clean then you are set.
Hopefully some people can enjoy this track and maybe this can give some people in my area the chance to ride their favorite track while growing up once again.
*Feel free to leave some feedback! Again could always update add some more roughness/more aggressive braking bumps and acceleration bumps.*
Huge thanks to anybody who helped me on discord, TFC’s and Resolutes videos, and Redrider197, Kellz & Cody, Ryan Cardno, Agitato, and Phantomz for the Assets

items.title: West Mx
items.creator: WESTERFIELD147
items.description:
Description
Downloads
West MX:
This is my FIRST track ever!
(I usually only make bikes/gear but decided to give track building a go.)
Depending on how the public reacts/responds to this project will determine whether I make it my mission to continue down this path to master badass track builder or not lol.
So yeah, I encourage you to express your feelings in the comments. It means more than you think.
Please & Thanks Guys! Much love!
Track Info:
This track is made to have fun on while still being challenging/technical at the same time. It’s not meant to be a hardcore 1:1 scale track that punishes you severely.
Great flow and each section compliments the next if ridden properly which is pretty rewarding. There’s a few multilple choice split sections but they are setup to be evenly timed to make it fair for racing (one line is not faster than the other and vise versa).
Everything is do able on an OEM 250f but you have to be on your game to make most of the jumps. The OEM 350f/450f have no trouble making everything. All race data is done properly so its raceable. 32 gates 40 pits.
Credit:
Reso – track building program

items.title: Reborn Valley
items.creator: ConsumingClouds
items.description:
Description
Downloads
This is Reborn Valley, my attempt to bring Prairie Valley from Mx vs ATV Reflex into MXBikes. It looks a little different, I wanted to make it like it would be today, with the last races being held in the Reflex era.
The starting gate has a small hill where your back tires are, and it allows for all bikes to have a much easier start, similar to how a holeshot device works.
There is an enduro trail with cool jumps and a canyon. I made a small supercross training area hidden in the hills.
There are easter eggs

items.title: Affinity San Diego Rd 3 2024 Replica
items.creator: Zalador
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Hey everyone planned for this to come out a couple days ago but the track objects and textures just was not where I wanted them to be but anyways the whole point of this track is to be a full replica of what they raced in real life as each track has changes from the track map to what they race, of course this one is a dry version and not a mudder like they had but the layout is now fully correct. I plan to make every weeks track but drop it a week after the race possibly a little earlier depending on how long it takes me. This is my first track so I want everyone to give me feedback of what they’d like to see better! I plan on each track getting better and better each round or so I hope and will take in everyone’s feedback to make the best feeling tracks! I am planning to make a series also I’m not to sure if it will be these upcoming rounds or if I will decide to make a bunch of custom supercross tracks but I do plan on at least doing a series at some point! Let me know your guys thoughts and if I should do a series with the replicas or do a custom track series! I hope everyone enjoys of all skill levels I tried to make it where newish type players can get on and somewhat get around the track but also add to where there’s a skill gap. Thanks to the Mx Simulator forms for the some of the objects and credits to Redrider for the toughblocks:) also shout out to everyone that tested my track! I hope to only grow from here and bring the community together and let everyone’s feedback go into my tracks! I’m always happy to answer questions and take in feedback thank you! Hope yall enjoy once again:) Will have a discord link in my profile for you guys to see what I’m working on for the future and also to give a more detailed feedback message! I also have a donation link in my profile for anyone who wants to help me out to putting money into better quality stadiums and textures

Welcome to Cadillac Ranch!
This is my first attempt at a track. It is a replica of a local track that got shut down. items.title: Decker Training Facility
items.creator: bakedMinotaurs
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Instructions
What’s up everyone!
Today I bring u Decker Training Facility in Fountain Florida. This is a LiDAR scanned replica track, with an upscale of about 35% to allow more enjoyment in the game. I only built the main track here, there are 2 more tracks at this facility but rain hit and didnt have enough time to prep those tracks.
This track is meant to be rough and choppy, so holding it wide open everywhere may not be the move. It will require a bit of finesse, and thought as u pick your way through the breaking bumps.
I hope u guys enjoy! I kind of neglected the offtrack more than i would have liked, but all in all im pretty happy with how the track came out.
I would like to thank everyone that has helped:
EarthWurx
Red Rider – Dozers, Earthwurx banner, water, help

Ryan Cardno – Warehouse building & Garage building

If i forgot anybody please let me know! I appreciate everyone that takes the time to give me advice/encouragement.
If u have any constructive critisism please feel free to let me know! i am still learning and strive to be better!

items.title: California Ohv Trails
items.creator: Lizard
items.description:
Description
Downloads
I’ve been California dreamin’ on all of these winter days and I made an area I really want to ride IRL and I hope you do too. Those big hills with the trails on the spines of the hills, and dirt ramps made by locals to scrub over them.
Features
Mapped trail with timing gates, minimal signage to mimic Dakar style racing where you rely on the map and a few signs. I’ve done an 11 minute lap time and I recommend the enduro bikes if you’re looking to have a good lap time because 2 or 3 of the hills on the mapped trail are pretty gnarly but I have completed every hill on a 450 without pushing so it is doable on race bikes if you want to. Another reason for the minimal signage is for you to make your own trail, mine might not be what you see in the landscape, and with all the jumps and overlapping trails that aren’t even part of the main trail, you can have some unique trail rides every time.
40 dirt ramps placed in strategic positions around the trails to land on the hills that make up the trails.
Animals – The Bear looks over the land, The Deer are all just hangin’ out, and The Lizard lurks along the outskirts.
Night mode – select either of the non-Clear weathers and it will be night time.
Special Thanks To:
Resolute Kraken – Track builder
Bishop – Skybox tutorial video
Cody/Kellz – Bushes and Trees
Callum22 – Dirt Ramps (from his Supercross template)
Anyone who made a tutorial on the track building process.

items.title: Swedish Midsummer Carnage 2
items.creator: Hellmachine
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Swedish Midsummer Carnage
was the first track I created for Mx Bikes, released back in February this year. Ever since then, I’ve been obsessed with track building, and I’ve learned a lot along the way.
I’ve always liked the concept and space of this track, but I feel like my lack of knowledge back then didn’t do it justice.
I kept the same layout but reversed it and created new jumps. Texturing is completely revamped, and overall, it’s better optimized and of higher quality.
I left the side slopes of the jumps smooth to let you guys be creative with transfers, added a couple of
ramps
, and even included a small technique drill area in the corner of the map.
Welcome to Swedish Midsummer Carnage 2
Enjoy the ride!
Hellmachine

items.title: 2023 Tdmx Arenacross Rd3
items.creator: D.Alves Mods
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Instructions
This is the final and third of 3 Arenacross tracks based on the Irl 2023 Brazilian Arenacross championship.
If you did not get the other two, here is the links:
2023 TDMX ArenaCross Rd1 – MXB-Mods.com
2023 TDMX ArenaCross Rd2 – MXB-Mods.com
I made all new jumps templates from scratch for these tracks and tried to make it as close as possible to the 1:1 scale but keeping it playable. For whom that is used to play Supercross you going to feel it kind of small but remember that this is an AX, an “small sx”.
It’s meant to be fun but at same time challenging you to improve your skills.
I recommend setting the erode around 1 if you have up to 10 people on the server, if you have more you can mess with it, and I would suggest setting between .5 and .8 depending on how many people are playing.
I hope you all enjoy it!
I want to thank all the people who made my life easy with tutorials, assets and knowledge.
Earthwurx, RedRider, JV, Logan, Dblu, Kewin Feula, StoneRider
– Help, Support, Information, Knowledge.
RedRider, Jesse Mulock, MoukLab, TFC, Agitato, Insane
– Tutorials.

items.title: 2024 Anaheim 1 Supercross Press Day Replica
items.creator: 3F Dirt Works
items.description:
Description
Downloads
🏁 Welcome to the thrilling world of Supercross! Behold my latest creation, a 1/1 scale replica of 2024 Anaheim 1 Supercross. This ambitious project was a personal challenge to craft a fully functional track in less than a week, had a few days to spare but wanted to get it released for the holidays. Track was tested using the new RM450 OEM’s.
🌐 While this initial release may not boast the finest textures, it serves as a canvas to showcase the primary focus — the heightmap. I was hoping to recreate all of the 2014 Supercross tracks week by week, not sure when ill start releasing.
🚧 Keep in mind that this project is a work in progress. If the response is positive and the community shows interest, future track releases will have better textures, finer details, and an overall more polished aesthetic. Your feedback is crucial in shaping the evolution of this project, so don’t hesitate to share your thoughts and suggestions.
Thanks to:

items.title: Moto Land Private Training Facility
items.creator: bakedMinotaurs
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Instructions
What’s up everyone!
After what I was planning on being my first paid track release, I thought about it some more and decided that what I have here is not a shop quality track. I feel like it would be a slap in the face to the better track creators, and the community altogether. I could have spent more time on it, but after 350 hours I kind of got burnt out after I realized I wasn’t 100% satisfied with it. I’m still happy with the compound, dont get me wrong! I personally feel it could have been even better.
With that being said,
Welcome to Moto Land! You’re very own private training compound that features 3 tracks, with 4 different layouts.
There is a “Pro Track” which is a more narrow layout, with the main focus on being more precise on what your doing
The “Amatuer Track” is a little bit wider, has some more forgiving jumps, and I feel suits newer players a little better.
The supercross track will have 2 layouts;
“Orange Dirt” is considered your normal SX layout, though the rhythms are slightly tamed down and not as steep.
“Grey Dirt” section is considered the “Pro” section, bigger scaled jumps, more line options, and tougher whoop section.
I only have race data for the Pro Track. I am trying to finish up the other 3 layouts but ended up losing my rdf data by overwriting it by accident and atm I wont have time to finish it all due to the holidays.
I wanted to have a complete polished track but instead of not releasing today, I will at least give u this for the time being.
Track was tested with both OEM and E10
I hope u all enjoy!
This wouldn’t be possible without the following;
EarthWurx – help & advice with all my annoying questions
Resolute Kraken – track builder helper & tutorials
Red Rider – 90% of the objects on this track are his <3 & help with my questions & testing
ParaMoto – van object
Jesse Mulock – truck object & testing
Ryan Cardno – Warehouse object
Dylan Frisch – fence object
Studio Frisch – epic logo & thumbnail
Benny Visuals – Release edit & testing
All the youtube guys; Lynda, Doc, Scizy, Kelso, Stratos, Smoksta for the positive encouragement and feedback & testing
Ruubs & RaceKar – texture norms (was given permission from both to use)
I will try my best to get the other 3 tracks race data as soon as possible! I’m sorry for the inconvenience. And as soon as Niko gets back from vacation I will have a server version!
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jAZUDctWhmg&t=8s
If u would like to donate, It’s ABSOLUTELY not necessary, but is GREATLY appreciated!

items.title: 2023 Tdmx Arenacross Rd2
items.creator: D.Alves Mods
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Instructions
This is the second of 3 Arenacross tracks based on the Irl 2023 Brazilian Arenacross championship.
If you did not get the first one, he
re is the link:
2023 TDMX ArenaCross Rd1 – MXB-Mods.com
I made all new jumps templates from scratch for these tracks and tried to make it as close as possible to the 1:1 scale but keeping it playable. For whom that is used to play Supercross you going to feel it kind of small but remember that this is an AX, an “small sx”.
It’s meant to be fun but at same time challenging you to improve your skills.
I recommend setting the erode around 1 if you have up to 10 people on the server, if you have more you can mess with it, and I would suggest setting between .5 and .8 depending on how many people are playing.
I hope you all enjoy it!
I want to thank all the people who made my life easy with tutorials, assets and knowledge.

items.title: Anaheim 1 2024
items.creator: Steezy Mx
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Instructions
****Re-Download*****
Welcome to The Night Show 2024 Anaheim 1. Steezy Studios build #8 Located in Anaheim, Ca.
I apologize for the many updates but hopefully this is the last one.
This track was completely revised on 12/6/2023 @ 8:00am. After rebuilding the first time, riders were getting track mismatch, so I went ahead and created a whole new track build folder. This version is 10x more rider friendly with a little bit larger scaling. The skybox was also changed from sunset to full moon/ starry night.
This is my first supercross build and it was tricky as heck getting the scaling of the jumps right. I think I did a fairly good job. I went through 6 or so different renditions and layouts until finally settling on 2024 Anaheim.
I will be releasing every round of 2024 Monster Energy Supercross season.
This all came together thanks to Jordan | PDR x Sentinel, Follow him on Discord. It never would have seen the light of day if it weren’t for him. Thanks, and I hope you enjoy your custom track bro! Everyone else, let me know what you think and get some practice in before Supercross kicks off next month!!!!!

items.title: Dade City Mx
items.creator: ConsumingClouds
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Dade City Motocross is a classic motocross track in central Florida where James Stewart and Ricky Carmichael grew up racing. This Track has 2 raceable layouts, an outer trail, and a sand jump freestyle oval that is hidden in the woods along the trail.
The Raceway layout is the shorter version. It’s based on what the track was like in July 2023. They race at night so I did my best to replicate night time conditions.
The Extended layout is the larger version. I did a little creativity on the layout this version and made it go into the woods so it’s even longer than usual. This layout is ran once a month and from what I can tell they only run it from 9am to noon so I made the sun be where it is in the morning for this one.
I included the track files. The more tools available for track building, the better. I’ve included a separate download with all the track files, heightmap PSD, texture map PSD, blender file with all the objects, skyboxes, everything you would need to make your own version of this track (they change the layout so often, you might have a favorite layout that’s different from this) or to make a whole new track, all the jumps, berms, and whoopdedoos are all separate objects in the heightmap PSD and you can move them, scale them rotate, anything you need. I’m not the first to do something like this, Calumdesigns made a template that’s probably easier to use than this, I used it on Reborn Valley.
Update:
Updated rut norms to 4k
Update again:
Fixed traction issue in certain areas
Update again:
Reduced late pop-in textures, Raceway version is now night time, better skyboxes on all versions
I hope you all enjoy.
Credits:
Gandolf420Kush – testing
RedRider + TypicalCanadian + Bishop + Gandolf + the whole tracks channel of the Discord in general – Help and Advice

items.creator: OG_SOUL_RIDER
items.description:

Welcome to the Freedom Center! This venue based in Florida is the host of the final round of the American Online Tournaments MotoTape Arenacross series. American Online Tournaments MotoTape Arenacross is a 5 round series on factory 125/144 bikes (
link to AOT discord
). I have spent several months on this series so each track will have multiple lines and will provide good racing. There are so many people i need to thank, ShadeyWadey for the BIG flag, MXB SHOP for pushing me to make better tracks, Stateline team for endless help and testing, Slabz for live screens/objects/and overall support/help, Red Rider for objects/ tips/ help/ and reflections, Endo for objects/textures/techniques/overall helping me get better with my track builds, EarthWurx crew for tips/advise/and object help, Typical Canadian for helping me with texture masks and ideas, Stu for helping with catch nets, and anyone who makes objects for track building. i know there are a few people i’m forgetting but thank you all.

items.title: 2020 Ferry Compound
items.creator: bakedMinotaurs
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Instructions
UPDATE OCTOBER 27, 2023:
What’s up boys!
I’ve decided to break open a previous track I made and completely remaster it with all new textures, objects, and more. This was the 2nd compound I have ever made, and was really just getting my feet wet
The supercross track has been completely rebuilt, has 24 pits but only 10 gates
The sand track has been updated with centerlines but there is no start gate, so its more of a practice/turn track. Also has 24 pits
The main motocross track has a few minor heightmap tweaks, just to make it flow a little better. 40 pits, and 40 gates
Soft Soil used across entire map
I upscaled everything, the original was 1:1 scale but found it super tight and just not really enjoyable. The timing gates around the 3 tracks aren’t super strict, but if you try and scumbag some lines you’re lap will most likely not count. Skydome image is a little wonky, so just try to ignore that. I may update with corrected skydome texture in the future
Thank you to everyone that has helped me along my journey
And special thanks to;
EarthWurx – for guiding me and answering any questions I have
Resolute Kraken – Track builder and tutorials
Red Rider- EarthWurx bales and banner, Water & Dump trucks, EarthWurx machines
Jesse Mulock – Help & truck object
Ryan Cardno – Warehouse & garages
Dylan Frish – Fence object
ParaMoto – Camper
Kellz – helped me figure out my tree issues
MoukLabs – Skydome object, and tutorials
Bishop & Typical Canadian – for roasting my textures and inspiring me to redo them and make them look even better than what i had
Fluke – help 🙂
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
UPDATE JANUARY 24, 2023:
Hey everyone, hope you have been enjoying so far. I updated the main mx track centerline and I also figured out my soil issue. I fixed some jumps and made it all around more enjoyable. I’ll have more updates as I continue to fix small things. SX track will get an overhaul as well
HUGE thank you to Jesse Mulock, this update wouldn’t have happened so quick if it weren’t for him
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
What’s up everyone! Excited to present you with the 2020 version of The Ferry Compound. This is the home of retired pro motocross and supercross racer Tim Ferry, along with his son, Evan.
This will be my second release, but the first track I released is a WIP. I put a lot of time into this, and tried to get it as close to exact as possible. Some slight differences but nothing too drastic.
On this compound you will find a motocross track, supercross track, and a sand track. I’m not that great at building SX tracks so go easy on me. I was having problems with my centerlines unfortunately, but will have those fixed shortly.
I really hope you all enjoy this compound. None of this would even be possible without the help from the following:
TFC- track tutorials, Track Assets, Skies, and water truck
Ryan Cardno- Garage Pack
Phantomz- Skid Steer
And everyone in the discord for helping me with my thousands of questions, I appreciate you all <3

KBell Racing Test Track
KBell Racing is still alive! The track has 40 gates and was made with all levels of skill in mind. Each rhythm has 2-3 smooth lines with some very fast lines for experienced players and slower lines for new players. The track is quite long for a supercross track coming in at about 90 seconds. The track was made for OEMs but factory bikes also work well on the track. I wanted to perfect my supercross “template” with this track, hence why it is a bit longer. items.title: 212 Moto Ranch Now Free
items.creator: eraaks212
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Located in Colorado, USA sits this fantasy track (In my head at least).  I created the heightmap from scratch and incorporated some techniques from past track builds. The track has some roughness built in, multiple lines, sand sections, 40 rider gate, and a large Kong jump that you will need a good run for to clear on a 250. The track arches have collisions as does the barn.
You’ll find some custom built objects throughout as well as some enthusiastic spectators watching your rip some laps around the track. The track terrain/texture was built to mimic a fresh track so that it naturally erodes, each lap you ride makes look even better.

items.title: Camp Sx
items.creator: bakedMinotaurs
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Instructions
What’s up everyone!
Today I present you with Camp SX. You’re one and only dedicated Supercross campground.
This track was originally going to be a throwaway, as I wanted to learn sx building and get scaling dialed in for my compound i’m currently working on. But, I was enjoying it too much and decided I would go all in on this and try to create something every mxb player can enjoy.
26 pits, & 22 gates
The layout is based off of 2009 Anaheim 3, there are a few section changes so it’s not an exact replica. I find the difficulty getting around the track is pretty easy, but to nail the big lines takes a little more finesse and patience. The template is made by MatRob from Mx Sim with some slight adjustments to the transitions, but I also have a few sections that were made with the Earthwurx SX template.
IMO track is easier to ride on a 450, but a few animals have informed me that a 250f has no problem handling these big lines.
Hope you enjoy! It’s not perfect, by any means. I could’ve put in more time but I’m pretty happy with where it sits.
None of this would be possible without;
Earthwurx – all the positive encouragement and help from these guys, it’s insane
Resolute Kraken – Track Builder Helper & tutorials
Jesse Mulock – TrackEd tutorial and testing feedback. He says if u can’t clear everything on a 250f then you’re just washed XD
Mouk Labs – Skydome texture and object, various Youtube tutorials, and for simply being a straight up G
ShadeyWadey – Flag model and tutorials (my flag texture is placed incorrectly, I just couldn’t be bothered to fix it. We’ll get it next time boys)
Slabz – Handicap capable restrooms for all your bowel moving needs
Higgo – Grass objects
Giopanda – Track assets
KewinFuela – Sponsor Billboard Signs
Calum22 – Linking a few various buildings
Scizy – Testing feedback and positive encouragement
Benny Visuals – Amazing track edit and thumbnail pics, as well as feedback on the track itself
Ryan Cardno – Warehouse
And a VERY special thanks to the following;
RedRider – Helped me figure some things out. Helped fix my tree issue, fixed my 90 corners, and gave me great feedback along the way. Also, 99% of the objects on this track were made by Red. (archway, gates, bales, finish banner, machines,  tents, water, water truck, bleachers.) Please take a moment to check out the amazing camp tents he did specially for me. Red is one of the main reasons any of us track builders progress, hands down.
Kellz – Helped me retrieve my flag from outerspace
If I left anyone out (which I probably am) then please feel free to call me out and I will have it updated. Also, please let me know where I can improve! I’m always looking for constructive criticism as I only want to progress.

items.title: 2006 Millville National
items.creator: eraaks212
items.description:
Description
Downloads
Small Update: Fixed 1 layer thickness for better erode. Noticed just after posting!
Hello Everyone,
The track is a replica of the 2006 Spring Creek MX National in which Ricky Carmichael lapped the entire field. I was in attendance for the race and always wanted to build it for mx bikes. I tried placing most of the exact replica banners, and some of the track signage around the track where possible. Track features 40 gates and pits, track cameras, and marshals.
This project was in my folder so I got it into decent shape for release. I hope you enjoy it. Scaling was started before all the updated OEM’s and Factory bikes. The factory bikes are rocket ships so I would not go bigger than a 250f.
Lastly, after 12 tracks and almost exactly 2 years, I have decided to hang up my boots and let the more talented track makers do their thing. The demands of IRL commitments makes it impossible to devote the time needed to make good, quality tracks. Rather than building, I’ll simply be enjoying the new creation releases. This also means I will not be doing the 2024 SX Prep tracks this year.
THANK YOU to the community members, track makers, and streamers for your support and positive comments. I always looked forward to seeing your track review/previews after releasing a track. I will still be riding online so if you see me out there say hi.
Credits and Thanks:
• Red Rider – Testing, Track Assets, Semi , and for answering my many questions!

Welcome to Fort Red! (Fort Dodge round 2 from Reflex)
I’m excited to finally finish a track project again for the community, it’s a combination of Reflex and MXB style where I tried to stay true to Reflex but in an MXB way. (tested with OEM bikes)

items.title: Florida Trails
items.creator: ConsumingClouds
items.description:
Description
Downloads
1000 meters x 1000 meters of Florida trails. Some parts are easy, some parts are difficult. The trails go both ways but one or two jumps only make sense in a specific direction but those are few and far between. The trails are all interconnected. No map other than what I was able to screenshot from track editor and even that has some areas where the water planes cover the trail texture. 40 rider spots, no timing gates, a race version is possible in the future if there is interest but these trails are for good times not low times.
The factory 250 4 strokes are perfect if you want to double your way around the mounds but if you are struggling with the them the enduro bikes work well at absorbing the bumps and should clear most if not all jumps.
Credits
Cody and Kellz –  tree pack
Red rider – Water
Resolute Kraken – Track Builder
Thank you all for providing these tools and assets to the community.
